description:
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Our Visa internship programs occurs during the summer months only.

Specific assignments will depend on upon your skills sets, interest, location and team needs. Job duties and projects could include:

Root cause analysis and documentation of software defects.
Apply critical thinking and problem solving skills to testing challenges.
Innovate on existing processes to drive continuous improvement.
Test and certify features for release
Write utilities / automation tools using Selenium, Java, REST, Python, Groovy, and more
Participate in cross-group and internal customer feature demos

Tech Interns will be placed within one of the following technology organizations at Visa:

Network Processing: This is the team behind VisaNet, the payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team strives to maintain quality through high-availability and high volume to enable industry collaboration and innovation today and tomorrow.

Issuer Processing: Debit Processing Services (DPS), our Issuer Processing platform for North America, processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

Merchant + Acquirer Processing: The team’s strategy is to build deeper merchant and acquirer relationships and increase total merchant value by developing solutions that address complex and emerging merchant and acquirer needs.

Digital and Developer Platform: Digital and Developer Platform (DDP) develops and manages platform-oriented technology to advance the global growth of digital commerce and the mobilization of payments. Pairing a customer-first approach and relentless product innovation, we build the underlying technologies that enhance value propositions for Visa cardholders and business partners around the world.

Data Product Development: Visa's position as the global leader in electronic payments enables us to collect and analyze a rich trove of data. Our team enables Visa to tell our data story through business intelligence and develop innovative data-driven products.

Data Platform: We timely deliver rich, high quality and easy-to-use Visa core data assets as a service, together with a reliable, scalable and secure data platform, that enables our internal partners to rapidly and efficiently innovate and monetize data-driven business products and services to lead the digital payment industry.

Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity provides enterprise-wide, risk-based security and continuity programs to meet changing internal and external threat landscapes. They seek to be the best-in-class at the physical, cyber security, network, application, and data security layers.

Corporate IT: CIT builds, operates and maintains the IT systems and infrastructure necessary to enable a highly connected and collaborative workforce that helps power Visa’s business.

Operations + Infrastructure: Operations & Infrastructure builds, operates and maintains best-in-class IT infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, and continuously available.

Open VisaNet: Open VisaNet (OVN) is responsible for building the long-term architecture for VisaNet and the future of our core payments processing capability. The team develops the next generation Authorization, Clearing and Settlement functionality that horizontally scales to support Global and domestic processing.

Technology Planning and Business Operations (TPBO): Whether it is communications support, change efforts, or process improvements, this team is built to support the Technology organization.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Cybersecurity, Business or a related field, graduating December 2022 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.

Preferred Qualifications

Proficiency in at least one programming language or technology including, but not limited, to Java, C/C++, C#, .NET, python, Javascript, HTML
Experience with Write utilities / automation tools using Selenium, Java, REST, Python, Groovy, and more
Familiarity with software testing principles
Solid understanding of software engineering concepts and methodologies
Document process, designs, test results, and analysis
Lead root cause analysis and track defect resolution to completion
Review and provide feedback on development code, test designs and test cases
Communicate status frequently to project stakeholders
Team player who is able to work independently with general supervision

Additional Information

Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.

Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

Sarma Internship Description: About Us Sarma offers multiple service offerings to help consumers and businesses make key decisions. These decisions range from employment, financial decisions, collections activity, profitability growth, purchases, and more. These services include but are not limited to Mortgage Credit Services Recovery Management Services Employment Screening Tenant Screening We are looking for part-time paid interns who are eager to learn and motivated to contribute to Sarma’s success. Sarma’s internships are designed to offer hands-on experience in a professional business environment. Interns will be supporting the operations, production, and support departments of the Organization. They will be responsible for supporting the office with challenging projects and assignments.. Requirements: Good computer skills including MS Office, MS Excel, Internet Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to multi-task Excellent communication skills, both verbal & written Customer focused and team-oriented Flexible hours for 20 hours a week, Monday – Friday between 8 am - 5 pm This program is geared towards Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, or related majors. Job Types: Part-time, Internship Pay: $12.00 - $13.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Tell us about your area of study and what you hope to gain from this internship. Shift availability: Day Shift (Required) Work Location: One location

We are seeking an energetic Electrical Engineering Intern to support our Engineering Team in our Sandy, UT facility. This is a part-time position. Candidates must live in or near Sandy, UT. Ideal candidates should be actively enrolled in a technical field of study such as Engineering, Computer Science, Math or Physics. Candidates must also be self-motivated, able to multi-task and be willing to learn. The Electrical Engineering Intern will participate as a valuable member of the Engineering team. This position will work directly with the Electrical Engineering Department to assist in the day to day activities. Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member. Assist Engineers with the design, development, integration and testing of systems. Assist with the assembly and wiring of hardware installations. Assist with the documentation of software, production and engineering data. Participate in the QA/QC process of software and hardware. Provide engineering documentation to other departments as necessary. Assemble/Modify prototype hardware designs using surface mount equipment and soldering iron. Conduct software testing and report test results. Skills Proficient understanding of MS Office Programs (Word, Excel, Outlook) Ability to learn MiTek’s internal computer systems and navigate network/network file structure Knowledge of general product aspects such as firmware, mechanical, and system application is helpful Knowledge and previous experience of basic hand tools and lab equipment EDUCATION Actively enrolled in a technical field of study such as engineering, computer science, math, or physics EXPERIENCE Familiarity with basic software development processes Familiarity with modern programming languages such as C, C++, C# .Net and Java MiTek/AtlasIED is an Equal Opportunity Employer' Work Remotely No remote work, all done onsite and candidates must live in or near Sandy, UT Job Types: Part-time, Internship Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: High school or equivalent (Preferred) Work Location: One location

a qualified IT Technician that will install and maintain computer systems and networks aiming for the highest functionality. You will also “train” users of the systems to make appropriate and safe usage of the IT infrastructure. A successful IT Technician must have a general knowledge of computer software, hardware and a variety of internet applications, networks and operating systems. The ideal candidate will also have troubleshooting abilities and attention to detail. Position Description: Information Technology technician will experience the exciting and challenging day-to-day activities for supporting software and hardware at our growing company. This person will be a valuable resource assisting with closing IT support tickets, assisting with software installations, setting up new users, deploying hardware, adding to our documentation library, manipulating data, and various special projects that will move our company forward. Job Responsibilities: * Set up workstations with computers and necessary peripheral devices Check computer hardware to ensure functionality Install and configure appropriate software and functions according to specifications Develop and maintain local networks in ways that optimize performance Ensure security and privacy of networks and computer systems Provide orientation and guidance to users on how to operate new software and computer equipment Organize and schedule upgrades and maintenance without deterring clients from completing their work Perform troubleshooting to diagnose and resolve problems (repair or replace parts, debugging etc.) Maintain records/logs of repairs and fixes and maintenance schedule Skills and Qualifications Required: Qualifications: Students pursuing (or a recent graduate with) an Associate or higher degree in Computer Science or other information technology related field are preferred; we will accept students pursuing (or a recent graduate with) an Associate or higher degree in an unrelated major with a strong interest in the Information Technology field. Basic knowledge of server hardware including web servers and network configurations Possess some knowledge of web programming or scripting skills Strong attention to detail Creative and energetic Hours per week: 20-29 30-39 Work Remotely No Job Types: Part-time, Internship Pay: $13.00 - $20.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location

Job Description

Visa Design Research sits within Visa's Product organization. Payments are changing with new players, experiences and expectations. Over half of Visa’s volume is now digital, and many market trends are affecting how Visa and our clients do business. For that reason, the Product team is focused on a holistic product strategy that allows Visa to ship products faster that are more relevant to the local markets in which Visa does business. The organization is at the forefront of thinking and working differently at Visa, particularly as we transform how we design, build and ship products globally for the future.

Our Design Research team in Innovation focuses on generative and iterative user research for projects with external partners, Product, Innovation, and Visa Consulting Analytics. We provide consulting, strategy, guidance, and execution of a full spectrum of user research services including survey design, diary studies, user interviews, design thinking workshops that support the needs of our high-profile clients. We find a rewarding sense of purpose in the inherent opportunity to make things better and easier for the real people who use the products Visa creates.

As a Design Research intern within Innovation, some potential responsibilities and projects during the internship may include:

You'll be immersed in various types of research (generative, iterative, and summative) throughout the course of your internship
Alongside the research team, you’ll interact with clients to understand how research will support their business strategies and roadmaps
Learn to execute full spectrum primary research, including assisting with survey creation, help create and lead design thinking workshops, and facilitate user interviews
Become familiar with a number of remote research tools, and learn to synthesize data to create top quality deliverables summarizing research findings and providing recommendations for improvement
Present and speak on research findings to stakeholders

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing a Master's degree in Social Science (Sociology, Psychology, Anthropology, etc.), Human Centered Design, English, Communications, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Business or a related field, graduating December 2022 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.
Permanent authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment as Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this role.

Preferred Qualifications

Classwork or experience with social science research, survey design, statistics, quantitative, or qualitative research methods appreciated but not required
Understanding of UX and the design techniques and principals involved in the production of conceptual prototypes, wireframes, and HTML prototypes appreciated but not required
Ability to ask for help when needed and address problems in a timely and thoughtful manner
Strong independent problem-solving skills, self-direction, and innovative thinking The ability to take on challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, resourceful and results oriented
Good team player and excellent interpersonal skills
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to lead and navigate through ambiguity

Job Description

This Intern role is within the Visa DPS Risk Services team. The Risk Services provides a suite of Payment System risk mitigation tools and services for our Issuer processing clients, and with these tools and services, delivers fraud rates 27% lower than Visa US Debit average. Performance measurement and analytics represents a key differentiator in our competitive performance advantages, enabling us to continually identify opportunities and hone in on areas to target that enable us to continually build on our performance differentiation to the benefit of our clients.

This intern will have the opportunity to work with our Risk and Disputes analytics professionals, developing and deploying data-driven insights and propelling our risk strategies. The position will also evaluate analytics-based solutions to automate key processes including client performance scorecards, client billing, and client performance insights for cross-functional management.

Essential Functions

Develop and maintain standard and customized operational and fraud performance insights across various measures
Provide analytical insights and data visualizations for Visa clients, team members and other internal resources
Research and implement better methods to streamline data collection and reporting efforts
Work effectively with internal/external resources to define analytical objectives, data requirements, obtain data and perform in-depth analyses to achieve a defined business objective
Build out client performance insights and measurements against industry benchmarks with an eye to identifying opportunity for performance improvements and/or increased profitability
Develop a comprehensive understanding of all Visa products and services

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Undergrad Intern

Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Cybersecurity, Business or a related field, graduating December 2022 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Work Authorization: Permanent Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position. Future sponsorship will not be considered.
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced Tableau Desktop and Server skills a plus
Strong background and skills with ETL systems, with Alteryx as preferred platform.
SAS experience: proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge analytic tools, e.g. SAS OR, Tableau, Hands on Hadoop experience is a plus
The ability to take on challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, resourceful and results oriented
Good team player and excellent interpersonal skills
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to lead and navigate through ambiguity

position: Jewelry Television - Email Administrator Summer Internship
description:
Come join the Jewelry Television team as a Email Administrator Intern this summer!

Jewelry Television - Email Administrator Summer Internship

As an Intern Email Administrator at Jewelry Television, you will be responsible for contributing to successful build, setting, and implementation of email campaigns built through our back-end systems (Exact Target and Bluecore). This learning-level, entry level position will help grow your knowledge of all critical components of email marketing in the retail space. It is an excellent ground-floor opportunity to have a hands-on experience learning about email marketing and targeted outbound communications with real responsibility and accountability that will increase as your skill level grows.

Reporting to the Senior Director of Digital Marketing, and dotted line responsibility to both the Sr Email Administrator and our Lead Email Administrator you will work closely with our entire E-Commerce Team on the day-to-day management of our work. Both of our Email team leads will guide you, coach you, and help train you.

Responsibilities:
Assist and provide tactical support with the daily email campaign management across all email products both heavily supervised by the Email Team & Web Producers.
Build HTML emails and campaign workflows (some HTML will be provided as you learn)
Will be responsible for tracking down, managing, and implementing creative assets to email working with our creative team while also performing QA on copy/links
Learn essential email KPI and learn script build to create reporting
Help prepare materials as requested by division SVP or Senior Director for presentations, ad hoc reports, or Executive request
Assist with email campaign strategy development, including audience development and be willing to learn to assign specific email products to particular audiences
Position WILL REQUIRE possible rotations of being “on call” on weekends in the case of promotional changes (be laptop/computer accessible on weekends for short windows as needed) – however we expect these on-call weekends to be much later in the summer intern period and only when needed.
Assist as needed with other email-related responsibility needs on an as-needed basis
Be a team player who enjoys a fast-paced, fun environment with a great team who wants to help you grow!

Qualifications:
Forthcoming Bachelor's degree preferred (preferably a College Senior on track to graduate) however, college courses building to a degree in marketing or Computer Science will be considered
Knowledge or demonstrated interest in technical or e-commerce landscape
Proficient with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel—imperative skill for position
Comfort working with types of graphics in .JPEG and .GIF file types – graphics will be made by the Creative team and your responsibility will be to load them, adjust sizing and spacing as needed
Attention to detail is a must with strong organizational tendencies – willingness to double check all work even if “you are sure” it was done right the first time
Problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to new technologies
Ability to quickly learn, grow and adapt to the digital team with unending enthusiasm to do something new
Good and emerging skill in copywriting or “marketer’s flair” for writing is a bonus but not required

Characteristics:
Willingness to pitch in for any task if asked even if it’s an area you are not sure about but willing to learn and ask questions
Be willing to learn a “business mentality” as it relates to discretionary info (such as customer data, proprietary methods), dealing with vendors, collaborative workstyles, and also rapidly changing strategy
Be ok with working late sometimes if the situation arises (likewise, come in early if asked and to contribute remotely on weekends in rotations with other team members)
An avid reader and someone who is voracious about reading and research to be a “student” of email marketing
Tendency towards perfection but also willing to accept constructive feedback as you learn
Be ok with periodic tight deadlines and/or revisions as they may occur
Highly collaborative who can easily work within a group but also can be a strong solo contributor
Must love jewelry or at least willing to be a student of gemstones, our products, and our process
Currently in our remote-work environment the willingness to be always accountable via phone, Zoom call, text, etc. with very little delay in response

JTV Perks:
Weekly pay period
Outstanding employee dental benefit program
Great employee discount program through local vendors
Exceptional employee discount on JTV product
24-hour private Fitness Center for all JTV employees and their immediate family
On-site Medical Center
Our employee park features a Walking Trail, Frisbee Golf, Volleyball and MORE!

Overview:
Jewelry Television® (JTV) is one of the leading retailers of jewelry and gemstones in the United States. Privately-held with a proven 27-year history, JTV leverages an omni-digital strategy designed to elevate the customer experience through holistic, digitally-driven touch points, including broadcasting live programming 24 hours a day, seven days a week to 86 million U.S. households, an industry leading mobile optimized e-commerce platform, and a robust social media presence. As part of its commitment to the development and distribution of educational content and consumer satisfaction the company employs numerous Graduate Gemologists and Accredited Jewelry Professionals. The company’s website, JTV.com, is one of the largest jewelry e-commerce websites in the country according to Internet Retailer’s Top 500 list for 2015.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 67461

Summary

Seeking for a Data Analyst Co-op to support the Operations Team activities to create Reports, Dashboards, and other Visualizations on data associated with Customers, Business Processes, Market Economics, and more to provide insights to senior management and business leaders in support of decision-making efforts. Also, to work with data, including Inventories, Logistics, Market Research, Profit Margins, Sales Figures, and so on. This data will be used to help the Business to estimate Market Share, Price Products, Time Sales, Optimize Budget etc.

Job Responsibilities

Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata
Using data to predict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
Performing statistical analysis of data
Using tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs
Preparing reports and presenting these to management or clients
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.

Job Requirements
BS in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or Mathematics

Learning Undefeated is seeking passionate and enthusiastic individuals to join its Lake Charles, LA mobile laboratory team. These innovative learning spaces offer schools and community partners teaching space, classroom resources, and captivating STEM learning experiences. Drop Anywhere LabsTM offers a one-of-a-kind environment and uses touchscreen walls, tablets, and projection mapping to immerse participants in an interactive learning environment. These custom outfitted STEM learning spaces are built inside a shipping container (Drop Anywhere Lab) that travels to a different school each week. The mobile laboratories offer a blend of career and skills education, providing flexible in-classroom resources that empower teachers. The Drop Anywhere Lab will mostly serve Calcasieu Parish schools in the Spring of 2022. The STEM Education Intern’s primary responsibilities include presenting motivating and engaging STEM experiences onboard the Drop Anywhere Lab. Individuals will also assist in the development of programs and curriculum, coordinating school and community partner visits, and supporting the management of equipment, supplies, and technology for the program. The STEM Education Interns are the face of Learning Undefeated’s programming and will have the opportunity to impact thousands of Calcasieu Parish students personally. This is an incredible opportunity to be part of a team that is changing how STEM education is delivered, with a specific focus on underserved communities. The ideal team member will be high-energy, creative, flexible, solutions-oriented, and able to handle rapidly changing circumstances with grace. In return, we offer an unparalleled opportunity to be part of the next big thing in STEM education and an entrepreneurial work environment that supports individual success. Responsibilities include: Serve as a positive, flexible, solutions-oriented member of a fast-paced team Facilitate age-appropriate STEM activities and extended or enrichment opportunities to students, both onboard the mobile laboratory and in the classroom Staff after-school events, such as family science night, and public events, such as conferences, festivals, and sporting events Assist with development of curriculum, activities, and materials for middle and high school students and teachers in accordance with the Louisiana State Standards Position requirements: Must have completed a minimum of 24 hours of undergraduate coursework and at least sixteen (16) credits of undergraduate classwork in STEM-related fields (e.g Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or similar) Outstanding customer service skills, a friendly, outgoing attitude, and the ability to work well as part of a team Must be flexible and adapt well in unpredictable situations Excellent organizational and communication skills Must be able to provide reliable transportation to/from school locations Must be able to report to a different school in Calcasieu Parish every two weeks Demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment Must be able to pass a childcare background check Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required Hours and Compensation Must be able to work at least two eight-hour days each week (Monday-Friday) Must be able to work shifts on a school schedule (7AM- 4PM) Hourly rate is $15/hour The fine print This is a Spring 2022 semester position with an option to renew for additional semesters. Interns must be available for work shifts on a school schedule (7AM – 4PM) for a minimum of two days each week (24 hours minimum). Hourly rate is $15/hr. The candidate will be selected for hire based on the following criteria: education, experience, subject area of expertise, communication skills, professional references, background check, and availability. Learning Undefeated embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. About Learning Undefeated, Inc. Learning Undefeated, Inc. is a non-profit organization that brings life-changing STEM education and career opportunities to underserved communities. Through innovative and experiential education programs for grades K-12, we are sparking interest in STEM careers, building the workforce that will drive the innovation economy, and bridging school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated interdisciplinary approach uses STEM to explore real-world, problem-centric curriculum that bridges school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated operates innovative and successful mobile STEM education programs in the Mid-Atlantic, Texas, and Gulf Coast. Since 2003, Learning Undefeated mobile STEM education programs have served more than one million students across 50 states. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship Pay: $15.00 per hour Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: 8 hour shift Application Question(s): Describe how an internship with Learning Undefeated will help you change the world (or at least your world). Work Location: On the road

position: Desktop Support Summer Intern - Longmont, CO
description:
About our group:
The mission of the End User Services organization, which includes this desktop support position, is to enable the success of Seagate employees by providing exceptional services that set the standard for customer service, quality, professionalism, business technology and cost optimization. To adapt to challenges on the horizon, End User Services must continually innovate new processes and embrace new platforms. End User Services is part of Corporate IT

About the role - you will:
Leverage your creativity in solving complex hardware and software issues related to an end user’s computer.

Gain valuable insight in troubleshooting network connectivity, application, hardware, audio visual and telephony equipment problems faced by our end user community.

Learn how to quickly adapt to situations faced by the end user in a fast-paced environment.

Gain real world experience in configuring, deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting computer hardware in an enterprise environment.

Obtain a general understanding of the Active Directory environment.

Learn how to follow processes and procedures to ensure that the highest quality of work is delivered to the end-user with minimal disruptions.

Build experience with maintaining password security, data integrity, and file system security for the laptop/desktop environment utilizing Bitlocker.

Document trouble tickets from inception through closure in an Enterprise Incident Management System such as Service Now.

Gain experience with Microsoft’s System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) and Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM).

Follow Seagate Technology’s COVID protocols such as daily temperature screening, daily health screening questionnaire, social distancing, mandatory mask wearing and hand sanitization.

Work Mon-Fri, 8 am to 5 pm. There are no work-from-home opportunities for this position.

About you:
You are an excellent communicator, both verbally and in written form. You must be able to communicate with customers, peers, and management concerning the status of cases, problems, or suggestions.

You can demonstrate experience in creating and executing innovative solutions to solve complex technical support problems.

You have a general understanding of computer hardware and software troubleshooting and issue resolution.

You have experience using critical thinking skills to identify and resolve technical issues.

You have knowledge of Office 365 online applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive and OneNote) and Windows 10 OS.

You have the ability to take proactive, corrective actions, to resolve issues in advance of system problems.

Your experience includes:
Pursing a Bachelor’s or technical degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software engineering or a related degree program and enrolled in Fall 2022/Spring 2023 courses.

A general understanding of computer hardware and software troubleshooting and issue resolution.

You can demonstrate knowledge of Office 365 online applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive and OneNote) and Windows 10 OS.

You May Also Have:
Relevant Technical Certifications a plus, including Microsoft, A+ and HDI preferred.
Hands-on experience in Information Technology solutions and services.

Location:
Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.

Colorado's 2021 Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (SB 19-085) requires we inform you of the estimated base hourly range for this position: $17 – $21. Actual range is based on fair market value of the role in the geography in which you live based on the requirements of the job and your skills. This posted salary range is a good faith and reasonable estimate, and Seagate reserves the right to adjust this range depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.

Seagate offers comprehensive benefits to its eligible employees; including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, annual variable pay bonus, 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, flexible and dependent care spending accounts, health care spending account, flexible time off/vacation, paid holidays and paid parental leave.

NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world! Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” Are you willing to challenge yourself, and build phenomenal software by working with the smartest people in the world? Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

Do you love writing fast code and crafting software systems to solve sophisticated problems? As an Intern on our team, you will be working on solving enterprise level problems using cutting edge NVIDIA technology and create impact in the world of Artificial Intelligence. Join the team build and deploy leading solutions for a broad range of applications using NVIDIA's own technology.

What you'll be doing:
Working on building AI products by taking advantage of NVIDIA AI solutions.

Apply practices such as Agile Development and Continuous Integration and Deployment to deliver early and often.

Collaborate with your peers to craft, develop, test, and maintain integrated applications and features

Work with cross-collaborative teams of deep learning experts and GPU architects to innovate across applications like NLP, recommender systems and MLOps.

Support, maintain and document software functionality.

What we need to see:
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Data Science or related fields.

Solid programming skills in Python programming and software development techniques.

Analytical thinking, a drive for neat solutions, and proficiency of mathematical tools and algorithms, as well as skill in solving numerical problems

You are very motivated, highly passionate, and curious about new technologies. You take pride in your work and strive to achieve incredible results and possess excellent communication and planning skills.

Ability to work independently and handle your own development effort.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience working in an open-source and agile software development environment.

Experience with Cloud Platform like AWS or Azure, experience with Kubernetes and Docker.

Knowledgeable about the latest data analytics tools, machine learning, artificial intelligence and how NVIDIA platforms are being used for data analytics.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people on the planet working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are now looking for a Dialog Manager Engineering Intern. If you have strong programming skills, are full of energy and enthusiasm, and want to innovate in untracked technical territories then this is the role for you. Being successful in this role requires designing and building software architectures that involve various key Nvidia SDKs and platforms as well as a willingness to build for third party DCC applications. A passion and interest in technologies such as dialogue management and Conversational AI are a must.

What you’ll be doing:
Building the software for covering different aspects of dialog management for visual 3D environments and beyond

Utilizing and iterating on a developer-focused tool for testing natural speech

Communicating with engineering and product teams who have technologies essential to the innovation of the project

Engage with developers of 3D design applications to determine how natural language fulfillment can be achieved in their own applications

What we need to see:
Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field

Strong fundamentals in programming and software design

Excellent fluency in Python

You strongly believe that prototyping is the right way to prove the idea

Able to work in a fast paced team

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Previous experience in building practical Conversational AI systems

Experience with building and integrating software outside of coursework – we want to see your Github if you have one

Familiarity with latest NLU research, like Extractive QA and Zero shot approaches

XR (AR/VR) programming experience

Examples of programming work to drive a critical need / demand

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative, autonomous and love a challenge, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Research Intern

AMD Research is an entrepreneurial research organization with a strong track record of driving research innovations into AMD products. We are a global leader in the development of the world’s most advanced high-performance computers (HPC), such as Frontier, the world-leading 1.5 exaflop supercomputer. As part of AMD Research, you will have a role on a winning team that works closely with government and commercial customers along with internal product teams and partners to develop the hardware and software technologies of next generation computing platforms, accelerating AMD to have the world’s highest-performing products.

THE ROLE:
AMD Research seeks a Computer Science or Engineering graduate student to work on high-performance computer software and hardware. You will be responsible for developing innovations that feed into scaled-out systems incorporating a variety of current and emerging accelerators and tightly coupled CPUs. The work has the potential to directly impact the current production software stack as well as influence the direction of future hardware and software.

AMD Research nurtures and encourages all co-ops to file quality patents and publish at top-tier research venues out of their internship projects. Previous co-op engineers at AMD Research have gone on to publish the results of their work in major academic and industrial conferences, file patent disclosures for innovative ideas as well contribute to production code and hardware designs.

Job Description During the 11-week summer experience, interns will embark on a meaningful journey and make tangible contributions to the organization’s success. This structured and well-organized program provides on-the-job training, mentorship, classroom instruction, cross-functional departmental exposure and an end-of-program project presentation. The Software Engineer Intern will be placed on a product team and contribute to the software design, software development, and overall product lifecycle for a product that our users love. The engineering process is highly collaborative. Interns will have the opportunity to pair on as they work through user stories and support products as they evolve. In addition, interns may be involved in product configuration, performance tuning and testing as well as production monitoring. As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be part of a team with more experienced engineers to help build and grow your skills while you create, support, and deploy production applications. Potential placements include product teams in eCommerce, Fulfillment, Infrastructure, Technology Management, and Data Engineering. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborates and pairs with other product team members (UX, engineering, and product management) to create secure, reliable, scalable software solutions Writes custom code or scripts to automate infrastructure, monitoring services, and test cases Writes custom code or scripts to do “destructive testing” to ensure adequate resiliency in production Configures commercial off the shelf solutions to align with evolving business needs Creates meaningful dashboards, logging, alerting, and responses to ensure that issues are captured and addressed proactively Monitors tools and participates in conversations to encourage collaboration across product teams Reviews and discusses code from more senior engineers to understand best practices and design patterns Increases business acumen by learning about other parts of the business Multi day intern orientation to introduce you to the company, the program, Pittsburgh, and your classmates Professional development workshops designed to increase your knowledge of the company and the retail industry, as well as develop their business acumen and office professionalism Extensive exposure to our senior leadership through our exclusive intern only Executive Speaker Series which includes a private meet & greet with our CTO & CEO Working with a diverse group of talent within company and learning how collaboration across multiple technology domains looks like in a world class enterprise technology function. Opportunities to “live the brand” and experience summer fun outside the office through various events Working a 40-hour work week, Monday – Friday QUALIFICATIONS Graduation date between December 2022 through May 2023 Enrolled in an accredited 4-year institution A major in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences and Technology or related experience Ability to work remotely for the duration of the program Exposure to modern programming languages Experience with Agile Development and knowledge on Agile Deployment tools and versioning using Git or similar tools Experience in a Linux or Unix based environment A competitive spirit with a passion for results Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to independently make data-driven recommendations Dynamic written and verbal communication style, as well as ability to communicate cross functionally and vertically throughout the organization Ability to work in a fast paced and iterative environment ABOUT OUR COMPANY: With over 25 years of experience in supporting corporate and federal recruitment, workplace mentoring, and technology accessibility initiatives, Bender Consulting Services, Inc. is the leading national expert in disability employment solutions for private and public sector employers. To learn more about how to start your career with Bender Consulting Services, Inc., please visit our website at www.benderconsult.com. Over 20 years ago, Stride was founded to provide personalized learning — powered by technology. We reached students where they were in their own journeys. We knocked down their barriers to great education. And we gave every learner equal opportunity to succeed — however they defined success. Stride innovated the learning experience with online and blended learning that prepared them for their lives ahead. Stride is a community of passionate leaders. Whether teachers, engineers, curriculum writers, or financial managers — whatever your expertise or role, we all work to empower futures through learning. And changing the trajectory of learning itself is one of our greatest missions. Join us in developing more effective ways to learn and helping learners build the skills and confidence they need to make their way forward in life. Stride is seeking a college intern pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in the area of Software Engineering. The Software Engineer Intern will work with other to help deliver leading edge software solutions that drive the K-12 education industry. The Stride engineering team will support and mentor you, but you will be expected to work independently and contribute original ideas to accomplish team goals. We use Agile/Scrum as both a methodology and a mindset. Prior Agile experience is beneficial but not mandatory. We are looking for smart and ambitious individuals who thrive on the challenge of creating quality solutions to challenging problems and have an unquenchable drive to create and bring to market world-class education solutions! The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for operating with cool stuff and you can work harmoniously with a talented team of software engineers. What is required is both a desire to innovate and successful experience in highly collaborative environments that create and foster a positive and productive team atmosphere. Essential Functions: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties. The core responsibilities include: Collaborate with teammates as well as other parts of the organization to complete assigned tasks; Design, develop, test, and document software to accomplish assigned goals; Participate in team stand-ups and ceremonies; Prepare documentation as needed to communicate and advocate ideas and report findings; Deliver final presentation to team and possibly other interested parties at the end of the internship. Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities. Minimum Required Qualifications: Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s degree program pursuing an IT, Computer Science, or Software Engineering related degree at an accredited 4-year college or university AND Experience programming in Java is required OR Equivalent combination of education and experience OTHER REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Strong self-motivation and ability to work independently Excellent communication and collaboration skills Detail-oriented with good organizational skills Excited about creating well-designed products for education Passion for learning new skills and technologies Demonstrated record of turning ideas into working software Ability to decompose complex problems and solve them iteratively Willingness and ability to listen effectively, respect others’ perspectives and contributions, and offer and accept constructive feedback Proficient in Office 365 and willingness to learn online tools & utilities (e.g. Jira, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.) Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, etc.) Web proficiency, including basic understanding of HTTP request/response cycle Ability to clear required background check dESIRED Qualifications: Familiarity with any of the following languages and technologies is a plus: Spring, Angular, Tomcat, Apache, and other open-source libraries/frameworks Unit testing, including frameworks such as Junit or TestNG Version control systems such as Subversion or Git Unix shell scripting Programming in Javascript, Python and/or Ruby on Rails Amazon Web Services Docker containerization Agile development / Scrum Using and/or developing web application programming interfaces (APIs) over HTTP, such as REST or GraphQL WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is a home-based position and open to residents of the 50 states and Washington D.C. Salaries will differ based on these factors, the position’s level and expected contribution, and the employee’s benefits elections. Offers will typically be in the bottom half of the range. Our work environment includes: On-the-job training Growth opportunities ***Apply only if you are willing to relocate anywhere in USA*** * Internships available for Validation Engineer positions for Graduates* Masters degree, or local equivalent, in STEM like computer science, mathematics, information systems, information technology, (Mechanical, Chemical,Civil , Manufacturing , Environmental , Process , Pharma/Biotech/ or related). We are seeking a results-oriented validation engineer to optimize our quality control procedures. You will be evaluating manufacturing processes, overseeing the calibration of equipment, and performing validation tests to ensure compliance with industry standards. Validation Engineer Responsibilities: Establishing validation standards and developing performance testing and quality control measures. Who's Clearcover?

Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We're proud to be one of the fastest-growing startups in Chicago, and we're currently looking to add an extraordinary remote intern to our Engineering team.

What is an Engineering Intern?

As an Engineering Intern at Clearcover, you will be embedded into the product and technology organization in the same way full time employees are. You will be included in a scrum team and paired with a mentor as well as an Engineering Manager. You will learn to understand Clearcover products, technologies and domains, work on active tickets to support sprint goals and contribute to product features all with the support and guidance of your mentor. You are encouraged to become familiar with other parts of the organization wherein you could have an impact, be that the diversity and inclusion committee, Clearly Covered engineering talks, etc.

What will you do?

Gain experience owning features from start to finish while collaborating with your scrum team to creatively solve problems and ensure excellent outcome
Be assigned a mentor for the duration of the internship who will be your guide to understanding the team, project and all things Clearcover.
Gain knowledge of software engineering concepts related to the implementation and deployment of distributed microservices
Extend our UI and APIs to enable system administrators to easily manage roles and permissions for our users
Self service enhancements that require spoke requests
Work on projects that impact the business
Learn coding best practices and how to troubleshoot and debug issues

What do you need?

Currently enrolled in a BS program in computer science, computer/software engineering, or related field
Experience with React, Typescript, Javascript, Python or Ruby
Familiarity with RESTful API conventions
A passion for solving complex technical problems
Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced technical environment
Strong communication skills. You are not afraid to hop on a Zoom call to share feedback or ask questions.
Eagerness to learn. You are a self-starter with a strong work ethic.

Objectives/Goals of the Position:
The US IT Internship program provides the best undergraduate students a unique opportunity to gain meaningful Information Systems experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Ready for an authentic experience? You'll hit the ground running and have an opportunity to create real-world business solutions at The RealReal. You'll be part of a collaborative team where you'll have the opportunity to both lead and drive results. We are the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, consigned luxury goods. This 10 week paid internship program will kick off in June 2022, and provide exposure to our e-Commerce centers and technology innovations that are truly disrupting the luxury retail industry.

Engineering Interns will join our team at The RealReal, participating in it's daily life. You'll attend standups, technical design sessions, debug issues with the team, and work on production code. The first few weeks of your internship will be ramping up and tackling smaller tasks - after which you will tackle a signature project, intended to ship to production. These projects are appropriately scoped, will provide meaningful business value, and will be presented to senior executives at the end of your internship. At the end of your time at The RealReal, you'll walk away with valuable experience working in an organization at scale - and a feature you can be proud of that survives you!

** Our summer 2022 internships can be remote anywhere in the U.S. **

What You Get To Do Every Day

Take ownership from day one; jumpstart your career as a full-fledged part of our business, immediately owning critical projects, joining cross-functional teams, supporting decisions and liaising with departments across the company
Take a proactive role by contributing thoughtful and valuable work, taking ownership of assigned tasks, and collaborating with your peers
Find innovative solutions to unique business challenges and continuously evolving needs, constantly iterating and learning as you go
Partner with mentors to review work, discuss goals and experience while ensuring defined projects are on target for completion
Attend engineering standups, technical design sessions, debug issues with the team, and work on production code
Complete a signature project, intended to ship to production

What You Bring To The Role

Rising Senior pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science
Prior experience or coursework with Ruby or Elixir is a strong plus
Prior experience or coursework with HTML/CSS/Javascript a strong plus
An organized approach to prioritizing projects and the ability to multitask
Scrappy, roll up your sleeves approach to problem-solving
Want to make a meaningful impact on the world around you
Must be available to work 40 hours a week
Authorized to work in the United States

The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.

The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements. GHR482

What We're Looking For

We are looking for quick learners who enjoy finding solutions to real problems. Why Vacasa?

Here at Vacasa, we help travelers experience unforgettable vacations. When you grow as quickly as we have been, every day is an exciting one. We embrace opportunities, and have a tendency to hand out responsibilities to our employees to see how they can stretch and challenge themselves. This is a place to grow as an individual, and to be part of our collective growth as a company and a team...and so far, it's been an unbelievably rewarding journey together.

We're searching for new employees who can contribute to our most important asset, our culture. Vacasa has eight core values that clearly define what our culture is. We're looking for those people who both understand the need for these core values and are willing to embrace and embody them.

ALL SOURCEGRAPH ROLES ARE FULLY REMOTE
Who we are

Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code, not just ~0.1% of the population. We help developers and companies with billions of lines of code create the software you use every day. In enabling more people to code, we believe we will create economic opportunity across the world and will drive progress that benefits everyone.

It's an exciting time to join Sourcegraph. Our company is growing rapidly: we've experienced exponential growth and our $125M Series D from Andreessen Horowitz and $50M Series C from Sequoia have given us the opportunity to make big ambitious bets on our future. We have a huge market (every company that builds software) and massive opportunity (most developers haven't even heard of code search yet, but once you've used it, you can't live without it-just like Google web search). By continuing to hire exceptional people, we have the opportunity to make Sourcegraph one of the biggest technology companies in the world.

Why this job is exciting

Search is Sourcegraph's core product offering. Our clients, some of the biggest names in technology, depend on our search tool to answer questions about their source code that no other tool can handle. Over the last year, the search team has grown significantly in size. So much so that it is now made up of two teams and we are still growing so we can innovate and continue to drive software development productivity.

The Search Product team owns all parts of Sourcegraph that help users compose search queries and consume search results, from our query language to higher-order features such as Search Notebooks or Code Monitoring. We foster a high-trust, high-autonomy, collaborative environment, with plenty of room for team-led innovation. Search Product teammates across engineering, product and design work together to make Sourcegraph search more powerful and more user-friendly, with user needs and feedback always top-of-mind.

During this internship, you will collaborate closely with your assigned engineering mentor. Together, you will choose a scoped frontend or full-stack project to tackle from our roadmap that will bring tangible value to Sourcegraph users. You will collaborate with your cross-functional teammates to make progress on this project, shipping your work across our Cloud and on-premise deployments.

Week 1: Onboarding

You will go through the same onboarding process every new Sourcegraph teammate undergoes.
You will install and configure Sourcegraph for development.
You will get familiar with the Sourcegraph codebase, and make your first small changes.
You will pick a project to work on in collaboration with your engineering mentor.

Week 2 - 11: Working on software

Start work on your assigned project.
Meet weekly with the manager for a 1:1
Meet and work with your mentor on a regular basis.
Join team meetings and participate as a team member.

Week 12: Offboarding and retrospective

Wrap up your project.
Participate in a retrospective interview with your manager about your experience during the internship program.
About you

You are a curious software engineer with demonstrable experience in building frontend or full-stack applications.

Qualifications:
You have experience building and testing web UIs using modern SPA frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, …).
You have experience using Git.
You're a clear and proactive written communicator.
You have a high degree of ownership for the areas you work in and the tasks you take on.
You proactively identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the team.
You seek frequent feedback from users or teammates, and use it to guide your work.
You make time for collaboration, but you also enjoy driving forward projects autonomously.
Your working hours overlap with 4pm-8pm UTC, so that you can join team meetings and have opportunities for synchronous collaboration with your teammates.

Nice to haves:
You have experience building and testing APIs, preferably using the technologies in our stack (Golang, PostgreSQL, and GraphQL)

Click here to read more information in our Handbook about the types of interviews we use at Sourcegraph.

You apply.
[30 min] Recruiter screen with Kemper Hamilton
[30 min] Hiring Manager screen with Loïc Guychard

In-depth Interview stage:
[45 min] Assignment: frontend live-coding exercise with Juliana Peña
[45 min] Peer interview: code walkthrough with Rok Novosel and Felix Kling
[30 min] Values interview with two teammates
Any other informal conversations with people who you would be working closely with but didn't get to meet during the interview process.
We check references & make you an offer
Not sure if this is you?

We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you're not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application, and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.

Learn more about us

To create a product that serves the needs of all developers, we are building a diverse all-remote team that is distributed across the world. Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all backgrounds and communities.

We provide competitive compensation and practical benefits to keep you happy and healthy so that you can do your best work.

Learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading our handbook.

We want to ensure Sourcegraph is an environment that suits your working style and empowers you to do your best work, so we are eager to answer any questions that you have about us at any point in the interview process.

About Finch
We are on a mission to empower innovators to access the global employment ecosystem and connect the world's employers under a single API. To do this, we're looking for individuals who think about problems holistically and in-depth, who are relentlessly curious, self-starters, and determined to drive ideas from inception through to completion.

Finch is a Series A Y Combinator company and backed by a fantastic set of firms, angels, and our developers including General Catalyst, Menlo Ventures, Homebrew, BoxGroup, YCombinator, Charley (1st business hire at Plaid), Sima (ex-Head of Biz Dev at Plaid), Henrique + Pedro (co-CEOs at Brex), Jeff + Wayne (co-CEOs at Digits), Immad (CEO at Mercury), Sam (CEO at Vouch Insurance), Karim (CTO at Ramp), and more.

About Our Team
We're a team of problem solvers who aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. We value velocity, curiosity, empathy, and diverse perspectives. Everyone on the team is excited about the scope of the problems we address and the potential impact our work can have on the global workforce. We realize that the value we provide comes with great responsibilities, and therefore make security and privacy our highest priorities.

We come from a diverse set of backgrounds and each member brings different skills to the group. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and potential will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns.

The Role

As a member of our summer internship program, you will have the unique opportunity to work alongside an exceptional group of technologists while developing hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment. Your growth and success are paramount to us: You’ll have the direct guidance and mentorship of one of our experienced engineers, and will be matched with a team that best suits your interests. We'll make sure that you have a thorough understanding of the different types of problems we’re solving; so that you can work on projects that not only excite you but drive meaningful, real-world impact.

This internship runs from May - Aug 2022 but we can work sort out details later on!

The Open Source Software Developer Intern will work with the Clinical Data Science Department to build and improve upon the OpenDBM Project, a free and open-source software (OSS), hosted on Github.

OpenDBM is a software package of machine learning algorithms that integrates several cutting-edge open source projects to quantify individual facial, vocal, and movement behaviors. The motivation for this OpenDBM Project is to foster an open-source community interested in modernizing and automating clinical evaluations to expedite scientific discoveries in the areas of digital biomarkers in mental illness and beyond.

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to provide meaningful contributions to OpenDBM – and as such significantly build your Github contribution portfolio. Your work will be vital to enhancing the OpenDBM engineering productivity infrastructure, project confidence, and overall OSS project maturity state.

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualities

You are passionate about meaningful contributions in open-source software to serve a public good
You are eager to learn and apply best practices and gold standards of Github Open Source Projects in technical writing, tooling, automation, and code commits
You find large challenges exciting and enjoy discovering and defining problems as much as solving them
You deliver. You may enjoy thoughtful conversations about problems and perfecting designs, but in the end, you know what matters is delivering a manufacturable solution that works every time.
You are a cross-disciplinary team member and team player. You are excited to work with and learn from software and machine learning engineers, behavior psychologists, data scientists, and medical professionals. You are skilled at communicating across teams and justifying your ideas.
You are resourceful, flexible, and adaptable; no tasks are too big or too small

ALL SOURCEGRAPH ROLES ARE FULLY REMOTE
Who we are

Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code, not just ~0.1% of the population. We help developers and companies with billions of lines of code create the software you use every day. In enabling more people to code, we believe we will create economic opportunity across the world and will drive progress that benefits everyone.

It's an exciting time to join Sourcegraph. Our company is growing rapidly: we've experienced exponential growth and our $125M Series D from Andreessen Horowitz and $50M Series C from Sequoia have given us the opportunity to make big ambitious bets on our future. We have a huge market (every company that builds software) and massive opportunity (most developers haven't even heard of code search yet, but once you've used it, you can't live without it-just like Google web search). By continuing to hire exceptional people, we have the opportunity to make Sourcegraph one of the biggest technology companies in the world.

Why this job is exciting

Search is Sourcegraph's core product offering. Our clients, some of the biggest names in technology, depend on our search tool to answer questions about their source code that no other tool can handle. Over the last year, the search team has grown significantly in size. So much so that it is now made up of two teams and we are still growing so we can innovate and continue to drive software development productivity.

The Search Product team owns all parts of Sourcegraph that help users compose search queries and consume search results, from our query language to higher-order features such as Search Notebooks or Code Monitoring. We foster a high-trust, high-autonomy, collaborative environment, with plenty of room for team-led innovation. Search Product teammates across engineering, product and design work together to make Sourcegraph search more powerful and more user-friendly, with user needs and feedback always top-of-mind.

During this internship, you will collaborate closely with your assigned engineering mentor. Together, you will choose a scoped frontend or full-stack project to tackle from our roadmap that will bring tangible value to Sourcegraph users. You will collaborate with your cross-functional teammates to make progress on this project, shipping your work across our Cloud and on-premise deployments.

Week 1: Onboarding

You will go through the same onboarding process every new Sourcegraph teammate undergoes.
You will install and configure Sourcegraph for development.
You will get familiar with the Sourcegraph codebase, and make your first small changes.
You will pick a project to work on in collaboration with your engineering mentor.

Week 2 - 11: Working on software

Start work on your assigned project.
Meet weekly with the manager for a 1:1
Meet and work with your mentor on a regular basis.
Join team meetings and participate as a team member.

Week 12: Offboarding and retrospective

Wrap up your project.
Participate in a retrospective interview with your manager about your experience during the internship program.
About you

You are a curious software engineer with demonstrable experience in building frontend or full-stack applications.

Qualifications:
You have experience building and testing web UIs using modern SPA frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, …).
You have experience using Git.
You're a clear and proactive written communicator.
You have a high degree of ownership for the areas you work in and the tasks you take on.
You proactively identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the team.
You seek frequent feedback from users or teammates, and use it to guide your work.
You make time for collaboration, but you also enjoy driving forward projects autonomously.
Your working hours overlap with 4pm-8pm UTC, so that you can join team meetings and have opportunities for synchronous collaboration with your teammates.

Nice to haves:
You have experience building and testing APIs, preferably using the technologies in our stack (Golang, PostgreSQL, and GraphQL)
Interview process [3 hours]

Click here to read more information in our Handbook about the types of interviews we use at Sourcegraph.

You apply.
[30 min] Recruiter screen with Kemper Hamilton
[30 min] Hiring Manager screen with Loïc Guychard

In-depth Interview stage:
[45 min] Assignment: frontend live-coding exercise with Juliana Peña
[45 min] Peer interview: code walkthrough with Rok Novosel and Felix Kling
[30 min] Values interview with two teammates
Any other informal conversations with people who you would be working closely with but didn't get to meet during the interview process.
We check references & make you an offer
Not sure if this is you?

We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you're not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application, and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.

Learn more about us

To create a product that serves the needs of all developers, we are building a diverse all-remote team that is distributed across the world. Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all backgrounds and communities.

We provide competitive compensation and practical benefits to keep you happy and healthy so that you can do your best work.

Learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading our handbook.

We want to ensure Sourcegraph is an environment that suits your working style and empowers you to do your best work, so we are eager to answer any questions that you have about us at any point in the interview process.

Go back to the careers page for all open positions.

Malwarebytes seeks an engineering intern who has an interest in graphics programming to join our UI team in designing and implementing code that will be used for UI/Ux and Experimentation with over 60,000,000 active users.
