Job Segment: Intern, Developer, Engineer, Computer Science, Application Developer, Entry Level, Technology, Engineering

For more than 25 years, Aptima's mission has been to improve and optimize performance in mission-critical, technology-intensive environments. We apply deep expertise in how humans think, learn, and perform to today's challenges. Whether for fighter pilots functioning in the cockpit, medical staff in the ICU, or teams collaborating across distributed networks, our solutions:
Ensure synergy: between humans, the technologies they use, and the organizations within which they operate Enhance productivity: through human-AI teaming, unobtrusive measurement, data analytics, and intelligent interfaces Accelerate learning, training, and readiness: with precision learning that is customized, personalized, and efficient
What Makes Us Unique:
Our culture is rooted on three principles that our founders planted, and our employees have embraced ever since— innovation, impact, and empathy:. At our core, Aptima researches, develops, and innovates within an area that engineering firms largely ignore, the Human component. In order to impact the world in meaningful ways, you must bring those innovations to light, and that is precisely what we do.

Entrepreneurial and creative energy run through our veins. When our team chooses to continue their education or professionally publish their work, we cheer then on. Teamwork, collaboration, and a relentless focus on our customers are central tenants of our culture. Work hard. Take care of each other. Lead by example. Accept others for who they are.

So, while the world knows us as a company that is moving humans, technology, and AI forward, we believe we are something more.

How You’ll Make an Impact:
You will work within Aptima’s Government Programs Group to develop advanced internal research and development solutions. You will be mentored by senior engineers and will have the opportunity to expand your career knowledge and gain valuable experience solving complex software engineering problems while working in a cutting-edge R&D environment. You will develop and deploy software components and microservices in local and networked configurations. You will develop and perform software testing by writing unit tests and/or performing integration tests and functional testing. You will also develop software to integrate with third party software and sensors and may support projects with writing technical developing end-user documentation. The software tools we are developing provide a variety of services enabling individual and team-based adaptive learning, including human performance measurement capabilities, geospatial displays, data recording and playback, data analytics, warehousing, learning assessment, and syllabus adaptation.

In this role, you will assist in the following areas: software development and maintenance, scripting and automation, software, and system unit testing.

You’ll Need:
Knowledge of some of the following: Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Angular/React, C#, Java. Familiar with developing scripts to automate repetitive processes. Familiar with concepts of message queuing, virtualization, cloud environments and DevOps Understanding of software development best practices and user experiences Good communication skills, both written and oral Ability to work well in a team environment and to learn rapidly via formal and informal training and instruction Able to understand complex system of systems environments Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
Minimum Requirements:
U.S. Citizenship required or the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance 2 year’s progress towards a degree in B.S. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, or related Technical field
Compensation & Benefits:
This is an outstanding opportunity to contribute to an innovative team and company. Hourly rate for this role starts at $21 per hour. Aptima’s comprehensive benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance, flexible & health spending accounts, paid parental leave, retirement savings, vacation, STD/LTD/Life Insurance, and paid professional development.

Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We're proud to be one of the fastest-growing startups in Chicago, and we're currently looking to add an extraordinary remote intern to our Engineering team.

What is an Engineering Intern?

As an Engineering Intern at Clearcover, you will be embedded into the product and technology organization in the same way full time employees are. You will be included in a scrum team and paired with a mentor as well as an Engineering Manager. You will learn to understand Clearcover products, technologies and domains, work on active tickets to support sprint goals and contribute to product features all with the support and guidance of your mentor. A passion for solving complex technical problems
Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced technical environment

Eagerness to learn. You are a self-starter with a strong work ethic.

position: Summer 2022 ML Framework Software Dev Co-Op/ Intern - (141463)
description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Machine Learning Framework Software Development Intern

THE ROLE:
Software development intern on teams building and optimizing Machine Learning models and system software for AMD GPU compute platforms. Work as part of an AMD development team and open source community to analyze, develop, test and deploy improvements to make AMD the best platform for machine learning applications.

THE PERSON:
Good skills in Python and C++ development in a Linux environment. Ability to work as part of a team, while also being able to work independently, define goals and scope and lead your own development effort.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and optimize deep learning workloads on frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX-RT etc. on AMD processors
Work with open-source framework maintainers to understand their requirements – and have your code changes integrated upstream
Work in a distributed computing setting to optimize for both scale-up (multi-GPU) and scale-out (multi-node) systems
Optimize the entire deep learning pipeline
Apply your knowledge of software engineering best practices

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Ability to work independently, define project goals and scope, and lead your own development effort.
Strong mathematical foundation in Tensors, Convolutions, Linear Algebra, Numerical Mathematics & Statistics
Good Python and C/C++ programming and software design skills, including debugging, performance analysis, and test design.
Knowledge of GPU computing (HIP, CUDA, OpenCL) and basic understanding of Deep Learning is a plus

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Masters or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.

LOCATION:
Austin, TX

Looking for a motivated person with a background in NLP focused computer science/engineering, or related fields. Strong programming skills preferred; must have curiosity and creativity to tackle new and challenging problems. Ability to comprehend academic/scientific literature and implement algorithms described in research papers in software is a plus. You Will Take On The Following Primary Responsibilities Help set the overall direction of our NLP efforts. Identify and develop cutting-edge NLP techniques to match our data and problems. Implement and maintain NLP services, data pipelines, and other products. You Will Have the Following Specific Job Responsibilities: Parse, validate and scrub data of widely differing formats. Build state of the art Deep Learning models using voice and text inputs. Build AI models to guide conversations leading to stronger human connections between users. Advise on most appropriate NLP tools for given use cases. Build and maintain toolkits or infrastructure to accelerate NLP/ML innovation. Follow cutting-edge research in the field of natural language processing and machine learning. Perform other tasks that are assigned by the Management team. You Meet the Following Requirements: At least Masters degree in Computer Science with a focus on Natural Language Processing or Machine Learning, preferably. At least 2 years of applied NLP/ ML experience, or 2+ years of experience in prototyping, evaluating, and deploying production machine learning and NLP systems. Experienced at cleaning and handling real world data, including textual and conversational speech data. At least 3 years Python programing experiences. Familiar AWS or other Cloud base computing platform. Stays updated with latest technologies like PerlAI, BERT, GPT-2, GPT-3, RASA, Amazon AI Toolkit, Albert, Roberta, Sentence BERT, Siamese Networks, Speech2Vec etc. Familiar with voice recognition APIs (STT and TTS) and Chatbot. Exposure to developing voice/chat assistants, dialogue systems or similar conversational AI products. Background and experience with both classical (e.g tokenizing, chunking grammars, dependency trees) and model-based NLP techniques (e.g. RNNs, CRFs, Language Modeling, Transfer Learning, Knowledge Distillation). Familiarity with algorithms and associated advanced analytic topics, including Logistic Regression, Neural Network frameworks and Natural Language Processing. Is familiar with mathematical modelling using Python or similar. Has a creative and imaginative mind. Is capable of working with a multi-disciplinary engineering and commercial team. Is articulate and capable of presenting ideas to a wide range of audiences. Nice To Have: MS/PhD with a focus in Natural Language Processing and Chat bot Experience in acquiring new data,and building new knowledge layers in the NLP model. Experience of going through full product life cycles, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization of new machine learning or infrastructure-related features. Previous experience in a startup environment and an appetite for rapid prototyping and building consumer products. Have experience with text to speech Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship Pay: $25.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Natural language processing: 2 years (Preferred) Python: 3 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

Are you a junior or senior pursuing a bachelors degree and looking for a career in software engineering? Are you studying and living in the Greater Philadelphia Area? Would you like a paying, flexible internship year-round where you'll learn and grow? Do you want to work side-by-side with friendly, experienced engineers then take what you've learned back to crush your classroom projects? Do you want to know you have a great job opportunity before you graduate? Can you start now? If you're thinking yes to all the above, consider an internship at Precision Systems, Inc. Precision Systems, Inc. (PSI) has been in the business since 1984, supporting leading companies with proven expertise in developing microprocessor, embedded, PC-based products, and mobile device products. As well as providing software and firmware development services, we specialize in software related consulting and planning. Our clientele includes Fortune 500 companies, the U.S. Government, start-ups, and privately owned businesses. The industries we serve range from the medical and pharmaceutical fields to military equipment and across many commercial concerns. This varied experience provides our clients a diverse array of software development options for their applications and our engineers with new and interesting projects to take on. PSI is seeking motivated, bright undergraduates to join the organization as Software Engineering Interns. Interns are trained and tested and once they are able to show they're preparedness, they work on real projects under the direct supervision of senior software engineers. Interns also work on internal products and projects for the company. The experience they gain is varied and highly dependent on the skills and responsibility they exhibit. This position is challenging and rewarding, and for the right person can lead to a full time opportunity upon graduation. Responsibilities and Duties All interns must study and be tested on PSI's standard operating procedures for software engineering, verification, change control, and configuration management. In addition, all interns must complete two practical projects that are reviewed and critiqued by other software engineers. Only after they have completed these will they be given project work. Project work varies, but it can be documentation generation, unit test creation, programming, test execution, or other project organizational tasks. The exact activities will change from week to week but the nature of the work will always be meaningful. Qualifications and Skills Requirements: GPA of 3.5 or higher This position is open only to juniors and seniors pursuing bachelor’s degree in CS, CE, IST, or other similar course of study with a focus on software programming Ability to work at least 20 hours per week, year-round, in our office in Horsham, PA Ideal Candidate: You have strong communication and questioning skills You have strong problem solving skills You are willing to take on new challenges and tasks that lie outside your comfort zone You have a desire for a long-term employment opportunity You are self-starting and self-regulating You have excellent time management skills You can set a schedule for your availability at the start of each semester and stick to it Benefits This position has no additional benefits. Job Type: Internship Pay: $15.00 per hour Experience: applicable college: 2 years (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Work Location: One location

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science intern validates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts.

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

Undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Business Informatics, Statistics or Mathematics or related field, or equivalent years of professional experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
Programming knowledge and skills, experience with statistical programming software (i.e. R, Python), and knowledge of database query languages (i.e. SQL)
Ability to identify solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Knowledge of statistical forecasting and machine concepts (i.e. decomposition, linear regression, exponential smoothing, support vector machine, k-means clustering, boosted decision-tree) and software (i.e. R, STATA, Weka, Python)
Data visualization experience using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar technology

Required Qualifications

0-2 years of experience with data and statistical analysis, with mathematical modeling skills

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

M1 Finance has created a personal wealth-building platform made for the modern era, uniting personal perspective and automated ease. We seamlessly combine free investing, low cost borrowing and digital checking all in one intuitive, automated Finance Super App, and we're driven by a mission to empower personal financial well-being. We believe that financial well-being is fundamental to overall well-being, and we strive to deliver products that are simpler, smarter, and stronger than those created by our competitors.

Our clients have already trusted us with over $6 billion of assets, we're currently helping hundreds of thousands of people grow and manage their wealth with our industry-leading automation and tools, and we're adding thousands of new clients every day.

We're looking for passionate people who want to improve and build on what we've created and take responsibility to help others build something meaningful and sustainable for their futures.

We mean it when we say. "M1 is yours to build."

If this sounds interesting to you, we'd love to have you read on.

Internship information

M1 internships last 12 weeks. All internships are paid hourly. In the current climate, our internships will be conducted remotely, like the rest of our team and most of your internship will be done via Zoom. We will supply your equipment and you will have virtual opportunities to network and learn about M1, the finance industry, and the technology industry.

What we're looking for

The M1 analytics team is seeking an intern to help our product organization surface data-driven insights about how people interact with M1 products, using web and mobile app behavioral data. This role will collaborate with a cross-functional team of analysts and product managers, to improve the M1 client experience.

We're a low-ego and fast-moving team that welcomes diverse perspectives.

What you'll do

Present deep-dive analyses of users' clickstream data to business stakeholders to help drive informed decisions about product and messaging.
Interpret A/B experiments and customer segment comparisons.
Gain experience working with leading platforms for product behavioral data (Segment and Amplitude), data visualization (Tableau), and data processing pipelines (Redshift and dbt).

Qualifications

Required:
Currently enrolled in, or recently graduated from an educational program with a strong technical / quantitative focus (for example, marketing analytics, data science, economics, statistics, computer science), with a strong interest in applied business analytics. Seniors and recent graduates preferred.
Experience with SQL: you should be familiar with joins and subqueries.
Familiarity with basic statistical concepts around the design of experiments, like statistical significance and power.

Have some of these, too? Even better:
Experience with data visualization or dashboarding (for example, using Tableau, Power BI, plotly, ggplot, or similar tools).
Experience analyzing data from a web analytics or app analytics tool, like Google Analytics or similar.
Experience using git for version control
Experience fitting basic machine learning models with scikit-learn, statsmodels, or similar tools.

M1's Commitment to Diversity

M1 is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate different experiences and we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) at all levels of the company. Women, minorities, veterans, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply. With our three DEI task forces (internal education, recruiting, and community involvement) and five Employee Resource Groups (Mental Health, Pride, Black, Latinx, and Women at M1), M1 employees and leaders set aside company time to tackle DEI projects and achieve goals every quarter.

Our Values

Our team embodies our eight core principles and if these principles speak to you – we'd love to talk with you.

Mission Driven: We will passionately apply ourselves to deliver immense value to our customers, knowing if they succeed, so too will the company
Extreme Ownership: We think and act like owners. Our focus is building long-term value, not scoring short-term marks. We own everything in our domain, including the outcome and everything that affects it
Boldness: We want to do things of consequence. Make a difference. We would rather fail at something meaningful than succeed at something trivial
Bias for action: The best way to make progress is to act
Economical: Efficiency is important, and we consider both the costs and benefits of our actions
Team-oriented: In working together, we maintain a low ego, make everyone feel welcome, assume good intent, trust one another, and seek out different perspectives. We empower our teammates to be at their best
Challenged, but not overwhelmed: We are curious people who always want to grow. Growth happens outside our comfort zone. We achieve our potential through consistent, manageable growth
Integrity: We do the right thing. When we make mistakes, we own and correct them. We would be proud of our actions are shared with our family, friends, and strangers. Everyone can count on us to act according to our values, beliefs, and principles we state we hold. This trust must never be broken.

position: Strata Clean Energy 2022 Summer Internship Program
description: ** The Strata Clean Energy 2022 Summer Internship does not offer remote opportunities of employment ** We are seeking Interns to join us summer of 2022. The Internship Program will run from May 23rd, 2022 until August 5th, 2022. The Internship openings at our Durham, NC office will include roles in Development, Engineering, IT, Performance Analytics, Treasury, Accounting, Construction management, Environmental, Project Management, Marketing and Environmental Health and Safety. In addition to working on individual projects with your respective department; interns will also get an inside look into Strata’s operations, by attending weekly guest speaker seminars, and participating in group projects, and field trips with the other interns! Departmental Positions: Project Development: Seeking an intern to assist with the oversite of site acquisition efforts, site entitlement; and help with the coordination of managing work of external consultants, contractors, and attorneys. Ideal candidates for this position will be pursuant of a renewables or business related degree program. Engineering : Seeking candidates who can assist with the production of construction drawings, bills of material, and other design documentation. Ideal candidates will have knowledge and classroom experience using AutoCAD. Students in pursuit of a Civil or Electrical Engineering degree preferred. Information Technology - Seeking an intern to assist a senior level Software Developer in writing code, reports, and building interface systems. C Sharp, Microsoft.Net and/or Sequel server knowledge required. Students pursuing a degree in Software Engineering, Software Development, Web Development or Database Development is preferred. Performance Analytics : Seeking an intern who can assist with data analysis of our O&M PV and battery systems. The intern will analyze data points and assist with running performance models while overseeing daily production forecasts. Students pursuing degrees in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics and/or Statistics is preferred. Treasury : Seeking an intern to update and revise document policies and procedures such as cash forecasting, cash planning, cash procedures, and outgoing and incoming cash procedures. Students pursuing degrees in Accounting and Finance are preferred. Accounting : Seeking an intern who will be involved in implementing a new system while learning how to consolidate and report on a high volume of transactions. Candidates pursuing degrees in Business, Accounting, Finance, and Mathematics is preferred. Construction Management : Seeking candidates who will assist with site walkthroughs shadowing Electrical, Civil and Environmental Superintendents. These individuals will review site plans, Plan of the Day meetings and schedules. This position will be field based on utility and/or QF (Qualifying Facility) solar/battery storage EPC projects with some office based activities. Students in pursuit of Construction Management or Civil Engineering is preferred. Environmental : Seeking candidates who will assist with site walkthroughs, inspections of wetlands, handling environmental agency requirements and creating reports. Students pursuing Environmental Science or Geographical degrees are preferred. Project Management : Seeking an intern to revising process and procedure development documents, develop templates for schedules and planning, and shadow Cost Controllers, Schedulers, Subcontract Management, Assistant Project Managers and Project Managers. This will be an office based position with 10% travel requirement to field operations. Students pursuing degrees in Construction Management, Project Management, Communications, Architecture, and Business Management are preferred. Marketing : Seeking an intern who will handle day to day marketing communications within Strata’s departments. They will gain hands on experience working on Strata’s social media accounts and assist with the new website launch. Students pursuing degrees in Journalism, Communication, Public Relations and Marketing are preferred. Safety : Seeking an intern who will participate in site walkthroughs for battery storage and utility scale projects. This intern will complete site audits, conduct incident investigations, present weekly safety topics and understanding data analysis. Students pursuing a Safety and/or Environmental degree is preferred. Qualifications : Bachelor’s students graduating no later than May 2023. Willing to come to the office full time unless the position is field based. Eager to learn and work with various departments in the company. Self-driven work ethic. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office. Job Types: Full-time, Internship Pay: From $15.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): When are you expected to graduate? What is your GPA (4.0 scale)? Are you comfortable coming into the office full time? Work Location: One location

Are you computer savvy? Do you like analyzing data and solving problems? Are you passionate about biomedical engineering? Then we have the perfect internship for you! We are looking for a bright, energetic student who is task oriented, organized and can work independently. The ideal candidate is working towards a degree in engineering, is available full-time during the summer and part-time during the school year. About Materialise: Materialise is currently the world leader in Rapid Prototyping software as well as Medical Image Processing software with offices in 21 countries and over 2,000 employees worldwide. Materialise has created a revolution in the 3D printing field by providing surgical planning software with our Mimics Innovation Suite, a combination of dedicated solutions for handling anatomical data from CT or MRI images and the Mimics Software Suite. Physicians and Clinicians from leading hospitals, universities and medical device companies use our solutions to perform surgical planning and development of anatomical 3D models. Ready for an authentic experience? You'll hit the ground running and have an opportunity to create real-world business solutions at The RealReal. You'll be part of a collaborative team where you'll have the opportunity to both lead and drive results. We are the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, consigned luxury goods. This 10 week paid internship program will kick off in June 2022, and provide exposure to our e-Commerce centers and technology innovations that are truly disrupting the luxury retail industry.

Machine Learning Engineering Interns will join our team at The RealReal and will participate in all day to day activities with other machine learning engineers to build fantastic data products. You'll build models, attend standups, help design custom ML solutions to business problems, debug issues with the team, and write quality code. The first few weeks of your internship will be ramping up and tackling smaller tasks - after which you will tackle a signature project, intended to ship to production. You will work on exciting projects in the realm of computer vision, recommendations and pricing - which provide meaningful business value, and will be presented to senior executives at the end of your internship. At the end of your time at The RealReal, you'll walk away with valuable experience working in an organization at scale - and a feature you can be proud of that survives you!

** Our summer 2022 internships can be remote anywhere in the U.S. **

What You Get To Do Every Day

Take ownership from day one; jumpstart your career as a full-fledged part of our business, immediately owning critical projects, joining cross-functional teams, supporting decisions and liaising with departments across the company
Learn how to translate business problems into data problems and apply Machine Learning / AI solutions to solve them
Design, build, test and deploy models to production; help design innovative or custom solutions to fuzzy business problems, debug issues with the team, constantly iterate while writing quality code.
Partner with a cross-functional team of ML, Product, Engineering, and Business stakeholders; attend standups, give updates and presentations at meetings with technical and non-technical audiences
Partner with mentors to review progress on the work and discuss goals to ensure defined projects are on target for completion; share feedback with mentors about the internship experience
Complete and ship a signature project to production

What You Bring To The Role

Rising Senior pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or another quantitative discipline
Also accepting application from Grad School students in a relevant discipline
Prior experience or coursework with Machine Learning and/or Data Science
Prior experience or coursework with Python
An organized approach to prioritizing projects and the ability to multitask
Scrappy, roll up your sleeves approach to problem-solving
Want to make a meaningful impact on the world around you
Must be available to work 40 hours a week
Authorized to work in the United States

The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.

An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. Sure, you’ll learn new skills, explore our enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. But you’ll gain something even more valuable: pride in what you’ve done. Join us and launch your career. We’ll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.

Northrop Grumman is seeking a College Intern Technical/Data Analytics for an internship opportunity. This position will be located in our Corporate Headquarters in Falls Church, VA.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s People Analytics organization.

Basic Qualifications

A candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university majoring in Data Science/Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math, or other quantitative discipline.
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022.
Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance if required (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higher

Intern Pay Range:
Bachelor’s: $24.00 to $29.75 per hour

Master’s: $35.25 to $37.50 per hour

At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Website Application Developer Intern We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled Website Application Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific aviation product goals. We currently build software for the aviation industry on both the B2B and B2C consumer categories. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee. You will also be working as a full-stack website application developer in our Product development department and closely with the marketing and design departments and times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the designing of the company's various software products. You will gain real hands-on working with many aspects of the product on the front-end and back-end. We are looking for someone who is very positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”. You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives. Responsibilities Design, build, maintain clean, and clever Mean Stack codes Work with the popular CMS WordPress Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of web applications Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems Work with the company's AI department and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the company’s web applications Apply understandings of web and mobile web app (Mean Stack) Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the web applications You will spend a lot of your time building web apps, efficiently coding in Mean Stack. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes Work with the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable. Requirements You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts Previous experience with javascript, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Java Previous working experience with WordPress. Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of web development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning Developing proficiency in Angular (v7 or higher), Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, Git, Postman, GitHub, AWS, PHP, Laravel, Rest/Restful, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build our web apps. Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor. Loves to learn new things about programming each day. This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment. This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time position. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: To keep our Siblings safe, we will remain fully remote until a working vaccine for COVID-19 is widely available, and the country has reached herd immunity. Application Question(s): Are you able to start working remotely within 1-2 weeks? (Yes/No) If you are from a Coding Bootcamp, please enter their reference code here. How did you hear about our company and/or this Position? Education: High school or equivalent (Required) Experience: MEAN Stack: 1 year (Required) MERN Stack: 1 year (Preferred) Language: English (Required) Work Location: Remote

Maestro is seeking software engineer interns for a paid, summer-long program designed to expose the intern to real work collaborating with our senior engineers. We expect this internship to run over summer of 2022, but don't worry—we can be flexible on the specifics.

Who we are

Maestro is a creative learning agency. Our purpose is to do good in the world by inspiring positive change through better learning experiences driven by creative strategy, design and technology. Maestro creates learning that empowers and inspires. We hire talented humans who are aligned with our purpose and truly care about the needs of our clients and everyone around them.

Who you are

You are a critical thinker and self-starter who wants to learn software development in a challenging environment. You either already possess development skills or are looking for a career change. You want to work in a collaborative and encouraging environment that allows you to learn and participate on real development projects while working alongside leading software engineering talent.

What you'll be doing on the Software Team
Collaborate with designers and developers to solve complex challenges
Learn development standards and best practices by a high caliber team that loves to teach
Build innovative applications with seasoned professionals
Participate on a team where you provide value and feel a sense of ownership
Explore the vast world of Software Development in efforts to discover what type of developer you want to become
Develop skills to help make you an employable Software Engineer in a competitive job market
Dedicate at least 15-20 hours to this internship per week
Talents we're looking for
Ability to communicate or whiteboard through critical thinking exercises
Passion for software development and development technologies
Bonus if you have experience with an object-oriented programming language
Desire to pursue software engineering as a career
Experience with HTML, CSS, Javascript
The perks
Hourly compensation. We take your experience and talent level into great consideration
Work/Life Balance: Maestro takes pride in the incredible work ethic of our team. Life happens, and here you have the time and freedom to deal with it
Remote First: Maestro recognizes that great talent and great work comes from any geography. Though there may be times and projects that require being in our headquarters, our team is free to work remotely. We ensure you have the tools and resources to do your best work, wherever that might be from.
We believe that creating an inclusive workplace helps us create better work

Maestro is committed to making diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging a part of everything we do - from our employee experience to how we engage with our clients, users, and our community. Regardless of gender, gender identity, race, disability, veteran status, religion, sexual orientation, ancestry, national origin, age, or marital status, we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.

position: Data Science and Machine Learning Internship
description:
ADP is hiring a Data Science & Machine Learning PhD Co-op . Are you looking for real corporate experience at a Fortune 250 company? Do you want to make a valuable contribution to a business' success? Are you ready to join an energetic, collaborative team and experience an inclusive culture of belonging?
If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and see for yourself.

As a Co-op at ADP, you will work on one or more data science projects within ADP’s Chief Data Office & Global Product & Technology department. These opportunities are designed to facilitate the transition from academia to industry for soon-to-be graduates and will involve participation and contribution in real projects being carried out by the ADP data science team. This is also a way for you to identify if ADP may be the right company for your long-term career goals. These positions are typically 3-6 months long, and have various start dates throughout the year. Most of the projects will involve tools and analyses in support of ADP’s product objectives.

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos .

Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now!

WHAT YOU'LL DO :
Here's what you can expect on a typical day as a Data Science Co-op:
Candidates will be responsible for providing analytical and technical support, which includes the collection and analysis of internal and external data to assist in building relevant products. Candidates will help to solve novel questions through tool creation. Projects may be product specific or focused on issues spanning multiple products.

TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Currently enrolled in a PhD degree program in Computer Science or related Quantitative discipline such as: Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics Economics, Computational Biology, Biostatistics or other relevant discipline. Expected to graduate in the next 1-2 years. Fluency in at least one programming environments such as Python/R/Scala and sound understanding of OOP. Ability to quickly prototype solutions to communicate their results by creating endpoints, APIs, and/or front-ends (e.g. Shiny, Flask, etc.) Familiarity with the nuances of data science and advanced statistical methods and ability to determine the correct method for the task. Demonstrated ability to problem solve independently on complex analytical projects (supporting evidence could include conference or journal papers, talks, open source contributions, articles, etc.) Applicants will be required to serve as the quantitative methodology expert by developing creative solutions and applying appropriate statistical and/or machine learning methodologies to answer novel questions. Applicants should be effective oral and written communicators. Applicants have a history of being able to execute on minimum viable products and strike a balance between methodological rigor and project timelines/deliverables. Experience with one or more of the standard machine learning and data manipulation packages such as scikit-learn/numpy/pandas/mlr. Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (Torch, Tensorflow, etc.) Familiarity with managed services on the cloud (for example: DataBricks, SageMaker, ML Flow, etc.) Familiarity with SQL & noSQL databases: Redshift/BQ/Athena/Mongo. Familiarity with Natural Language Processing, Image Processing, Reinforcement Learning, Deep Neural Networks, Graphs, etc.

YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:
Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner.
Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life.
What are you waiting for? Apply today!
Explore our COVID-19 page https://tech.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.
Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. Northrop Grumman is seeking Computer Systems Analyst to join the Space Systems Intern Program. This position will be located in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Hardware Engineering Organization, DARC/SMORS, HW Design, Payload & Ground Systems Division. The selected candidate will work in a Integrated program and HW Design team.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of Electrical Engineering specializations that may include:

Computer systems performance analysis
Computer Network Architecture performance analysis
Digital hardware component specification development and key critical parameter identification
Assembly, Integration, and Test of HW components
Computer Systems requirements development within DOORS

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics Technology
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Experience with Microsoft office tool suite

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher
Previous internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular).
Good presentation and writing/communication skills.
Self-motivated, willing to learn, and interested in working in a team environment.
Experience in developing and delivering presentations and leading small groups.
Experience in working in an autonomous work environment on complex projects.
Experience in working on business or engineering full life-cycle projects from project inception through launch.

Come help us build the world's most reliable on-demand logistics engine for delivery! We're bringing on talented scientists/engineers to help us create the real-time logistics platform that powers DoorDash’s three-sided marketplace of consumers, merchants, and dashers.

You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…
Design and implement improvements to our real-time on-demand dispatching algorithm
Analyze data to understand each delivery at the lowest level of detail, perform cutting-edge research, and inspire new lines of work
Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, product managers, business operators, and more to develop cross-cutting and scalable solutions to drive value for our consumers, dashers, and merchants
Receive actionable feedback and coaching from your mentor and team members
Socialize with and learn from colleagues all across the company, through events including Lunch and Learns with executive members, game nights, movie nights, intern offsites, and more
Present your summer accomplishments to the company during Demo Day at the end of the internship
We’re excited about you because…
You have a PhD. or masters student in operations research, industrial engineering, computer science or a related field graduating in Winter 2022 or Spring 2023
You have research or industry experience working on complex optimization problems through mathematical programming or metaheuristics
You have strong programming fundamentals, experience in object oriented and/or functional programming languages, and a solid understanding of algorithms
You have strong communication skills
You are excited to analyze, iterate, and contribute to our state-of-the-art real-time dispatch system
Nice to haves
Experience developing algorithms for logistics problems, especially VRP and real time dispatching problem
Experience with mathematical programming software packages like Cplex, Gurobi, Coin-OR, or Xpress
Production experience with a JVM-based language (ie Java, Kotlin, Scala, etc)
Experience with software development lifecycle (writing clean code, version control, unit testing, etc)
Production experience with modern web applications at scale
Experience with statistical analysis and machine learning algorithms
Proficient with SQL and a visualization tool (ie Tableau, Chartio, Mode, etc)
About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

position: Software Engineer in Test Intern (Bachelors/Masters) - 2022 Fall
description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Internships at TikTok aim to provide students the chance to work with our clients and teams to address key business problems and identify areas of growth for the company. With your education and experience, you will be able to take on real-world challenges from day one.

This 100% remote 12-week Internship Program will begin in August/September 2022. While remote, all interns will need to be physically located in one of the 12 locations approved for US remote employment: California, Washington State, Illinois, New York, New Jersey, Florida, Washington D.C., Virginia, Tennessee, Texas, Georgia, and Michigan. Note: Your location this summer will be based on your preference (i.e. you can work from New Jersey for a Los Angeles-based team, etc.) as long as it is listed above.

Application deadline: August 5, 2022
Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all campus jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.

Teams:
Ads Quality Assurance
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the entire process of advertising system testing, including requirements analysis, design review, formulating test plans, designing and executing test cases, conducting defect tracking and software quality analysis, etc. Participate in the development of automated testing tools/frameworks, design and execution of automated test cases, automatically building test environments, and continuous integration. Understand the tools and techniques used in developing new products and work with cross-functionality teams to establish and refine dashboards and metrics to facilitate our data-driven approach. Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field Able to commit to working for 12 weeks during Fall 2022 Experience with coding in Python, Java, Golang, C#, or C++ Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities Solid computer basics (network/database/algorithm). Familiar with API test platform, pytest, diff tools is a plus.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

We’re the world leader in Resilient Positioning, Navigation and Timing (R-PNT) solutions that improve the reliability, performance, and safety of critical high-risk operations, even in GPS/GNSS denied environments. We provide virtually fail-safe GNSS and PNT solutions for military and commercial applications worldwide. AKA- we do pretty awesome things!

As an Engineer Intern, you will primarily working on our Timing Products and our GNSS Simulation Products.

We're looking for Interns enrolled in a four-year or post-graduate degree program in the following or related fields:

Electrical Engineering
Computer Engineering
Computer Science
Mechanical Engineering
Signal Processing
Radio Communications

What you’ll be doing:
Working closely with Lead Engineers in in a lab environment designing the latest GPS-based and alternative PNT equipment and software

Testing new products, new features and software releases to ensure our products meet the highest standards and specifications.

Devising test procedures, experiments, test fixtures and software; performing those tests, analyzing the results and generating comprehensive test reports and recommendations.

Analyzing and debugging problem reports and designing fixes

Working with vendors, subcontractors, and customers to understand their needs and applications toward solving problems in deployments

Working in a multi-discipline, multi-cultural environmental with cross-functional teams toward a common design goal.

About Our Team:
Global Collaboration: We pride ourselves on personal excellence through global collaboration, communication and team achievement!

Fun: We are at our best having fun and we bring the best out of each other.

Innovation: We love to develop and implement creative solutions!

Commitment: We persevere in all situations.

Agility: Our business, strategies and our people are ready to adapt to evolving needs of our markets.

Continuous Improvement: We’re curious and we always demonstrate the desire to improve results and challenge the status quo.

Why Orolia?

Orolia is an international high-tech company dedicated to improving the safety, compliance and efficiency of its global customers’ remote operations by providing them business solutions and services based on the most advanced positioning, navigation, timing, sensing, information, and communications technologies. At Orolia, we continuously look to go “Beyond the Frontier” in everything that we do. As an organization, we strive to be the market leader and look for employees who have the same passion for their personal careers. If you love working in a multicultural environment where being the best is encouraged, Orolia is the employer for you.

Orolia believes that success in the global marketplace requires a variety of perspectives and individual experiences. At Orolia, we understand, appreciate and strive for new and different thoughts and ideas. A high degree of employee involvement, lifelong learning and diversity are permanent items on the agenda throughout the entire organization.

Please note this description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Orolia is an equal opportunity employer who does not discriminate based on race, color, citizenship, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran’s status or any protected category. We encourage veterans and people with disabilities to apply.

Northrop Grumman is seeking an intern to join the Atmospheric Effects Group Intern Program. This position will be located in McLean, VA.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Payload and Ground Systems Division.

The Atmospheric Effects Group is developing atmospheric models and prediction systems to help understand and mitigate atmospheric effects on optical communications in support of multiple NASA missions. We are seeking an intern for the Summer of 2022 to gain hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Numerical Weather Prediction and data analysis to support these missions. Internship will be performed in a hybrid work environment including in-person and virtual.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of engineering specializations that may include:

Roles and Responsibilities

Intern will work under the supervision of a technical lead.
Will learn to run existing atmospheric models and tools (e.g., WRF and other custom tools).
Analyze large datasets with Python and produce summary results.
Compose and deliver weekly technical briefings to team.

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in Meteorology, Data Science, Computer Science or similar STEM.
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Proficient knowledge of Python (numpy, matplotlib, cartopy)
Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience with NOAA GOES satellite data
Working knowledge of statistics for data analysis
Well-organized and detail oriented
Good written and oral communication skills
Able to work in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher

Masters: $32.25 - $33.25

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. position: Intern V-Tech: Natural Hazards Research Internship
description:
Overview:
Exciting and interesting technical challenges await when you join a world-class research team dedicated to reducing the impact of natural hazards and climate risks. FM Global is a market leader in commercial and industrial property insurance and loss prevention solutions, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000 companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art engineering and research.

Responsibilities:
The Structures and Natural Hazards research group at FM Global is looking for creative, self-motivated individuals for internships. Selected candidates will work alongside a unique group of scientists across engineering, earth, and atmospheric sciences to protect the value of FM Global clients' businesses by developing methods to identify hazards, assess risk, and produce loss prevention solutions that are efficient and cost-effective. The internship will be supervised by senior staff in the Structures and Natural Hazards research group and provides an opportunity to engage in solving real-world science and engineering problems in the insurance industry.

Qualifications:
Ideal candidates are PhD graduate students (with good academic standing for graduation), who are seeking to expand their research experience beyond academia and bring expertise in the following active research areas:

Atmospheric Science (severe weather, hail, tornados)
Geological Science (land subsidence)
Climate Change (extreme heat, drought, sea level rise)
Strong analytical skills and solid knowledge of probability and statistics
Experience in at least two programming languages such as MATLAB, R, Python, and FORTRAN
Comfortable writing shell scripts and using APIs to automate workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in processing large volumes of data (including NetCDF, HDF, and GRIB formats)
Comfortable in Microsoft Windows and Linux environments
GIS skills (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, GDAL)

Experience in computer science, statistics, machine learning
Experience and understanding of climate model output (CMIP6, CORDEX)

Please note that all FM Global visitors, including external candidates interviewing for open positions will be required to be vaccinated and should be prepared to provide proof of vaccination.

FM Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science intern validates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts.

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

Undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Business Informatics, Statistics or Mathematics or related field, or equivalent years of professional experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
Programming knowledge and skills, experience with statistical programming software (i.e. R, Python), and knowledge of database query languages (i.e. SQL)
Ability to identify solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Knowledge of statistical forecasting and machine concepts (i.e. decomposition, linear regression, exponential smoothing, support vector machine, k-means clustering, boosted decision-tree) and software (i.e. R, STATA, Weka, Python)
Data visualization experience using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar technology

Required Qualifications

0-2 years of experience with data and statistical analysis, with mathematical modeling skills

Ready for an authentic experience? You'll hit the ground running and have an opportunity to create real-world business solutions at The RealReal. You'll be part of a collaborative team where you'll have the opportunity to both lead and drive results. We are the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, consigned luxury goods. This 10 week paid internship program will kick off in June 2022, and provide exposure to our e-Commerce centers and technology innovations that are truly disrupting the luxury retail industry.

Machine Learning Engineering Interns will join our team at The RealReal and will participate in all day to day activities with other machine learning engineers to build fantastic data products. You'll build models, attend standups, help design custom ML solutions to business problems, debug issues with the team, and write quality code. The first few weeks of your internship will be ramping up and tackling smaller tasks - after which you will tackle a signature project, intended to ship to production. You will work on exciting projects in the realm of computer vision, recommendations and pricing - which provide meaningful business value, and will be presented to senior executives at the end of your internship. At the end of your time at The RealReal, you'll walk away with valuable experience working in an organization at scale - and a feature you can be proud of that survives you!

** Our summer 2022 internships can be remote anywhere in the U.S. **

What You Get To Do Every Day

Take ownership from day one; jumpstart your career as a full-fledged part of our business, immediately owning critical projects, joining cross-functional teams, supporting decisions and liaising with departments across the company
Learn how to translate business problems into data problems and apply Machine Learning / AI solutions to solve them
Design, build, test and deploy models to production; help design innovative or custom solutions to fuzzy business problems, debug issues with the team, constantly iterate while writing quality code.
Partner with a cross-functional team of ML, Product, Engineering, and Business stakeholders; attend standups, give updates and presentations at meetings with technical and non-technical audiences
Partner with mentors to review progress on the work and discuss goals to ensure defined projects are on target for completion; share feedback with mentors about the internship experience
Complete and ship a signature project to production

What You Bring To The Role

Rising Senior pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or another quantitative discipline
Also accepting application from Grad School students in a relevant discipline
Prior experience or coursework with Machine Learning and/or Data Science
Prior experience or coursework with Python
An organized approach to prioritizing projects and the ability to multitask
Scrappy, roll up your sleeves approach to problem-solving
Want to make a meaningful impact on the world around you
Must be available to work 40 hours a week
Authorized to work in the United States

The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.
