Now Hiring Automation Engineering Interns for our 2022 Summer Internship!

There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Competitive compensation
Advancement opportunities
Training
Paid time off
Low-cost medical, dental, vision
Company-paid life and disability
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Why This Job

To be a leader you’ve got to stay ahead of the curve. That’s why CMC has always been — and will continue to be — an early adopter of smart, new manufacturing techniques and technology. Our automated Steel Micro Mill in Durant, OK melted and rolled our first heat in December of 2017. We connect the two main steps in rebar production - melting recyced scrap into molten steel and forming that steel into a finished product in a single uninterrupted strand. We also use energy more efficiently than the mini mill and our technology allows us to cast steel faster and to run continuously.

Internship Details

CMC Steel Oklahoma is seeking students currently enrolled in an accredited Bachelor's Automation-related degree program (Automation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronic Engineering, Computer Science) for our 2022 Summer Internship Program. This internship gives you exposure to our full process from scrap metal to finished rebar. You will work alongside production, maintenance, engineering and leadership to put your education to practice and build a career for yourself. You will be provided meaningful projects that not only develop you but leave a long standing impact to our melting, continuous-continous casting and rolling process. In all, you will walk away with experience in:

Job shadowing highly skilled Engineers (Automation, Electrical, Mechanical, Reliability) and leadership
Mentorship Assignment
Networking with fellow interns and buisness leaders
Meaningful assignments
Summer Project Presentation
What You'll Do
Cross-train through the department to learn hands-on skills related to industrial/engineering technologies
Document and report/suggest changes
Work with leadership on ways to improve & sustain processes
Create/Review/Update existing process flow layouts
Identify, evaluate, and recommend cost saving opportunities by identifying process, quality and safety related improvement projects
Presentation/Report on an improvement project at the end of internship
Interact with technical engineers and non-technical operations personnel to integrate new technologies and update existing systems, as well as provide technical troubleshooting support to operations.
What You'll Need
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills with an aptitude of problem solving
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to work in teams and to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization
Able to work independently, take initiative and drive for results with minimal supervision
Ability to interact with coworkers and customers in a positive manner, follow directions and work rules and accept constructive feedback required
Must be at least 18 years old
Understanding of Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement processes

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.

If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways that connect our communities, and raise the bar for what it means to do meaningful work day in and day out. In short, you’re ready to be part of CMC. Join us and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

Project details:
Project's primary technology stack - C/C++/Python, eBPF
Scope of the project – Build a new service from the ground up that will ship with every Nutanix cluster and be used in production by thousands of Nutanix customers. The service provides acceleration/monitoring/statistics for inter-service communication using eBPF.

Now Hiring Automation Engineering Interns for our 2022 Summer Internship!

There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Competitive compensation
Advancement opportunities
Training
Paid time off
Low-cost medical, dental, vision
Company-paid life and disability
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Why This Job

To be a leader you’ve got to stay ahead of the curve. That’s why CMC has always been — and will continue to be — an early adopter of smart, new manufacturing techniques and technology. Our automated Steel Micro Mill in Durant, OK melted and rolled our first heat in December of 2017. We connect the two main steps in rebar production - melting recyced scrap into molten steel and forming that steel into a finished product in a single uninterrupted strand. We also use energy more efficiently than the mini mill and our technology allows us to cast steel faster and to run continuously.

Internship Details

CMC Steel Oklahoma is seeking students currently enrolled in an accredited Bachelor's Automation-related degree program (Automation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronic Engineering, Computer Science) for our 2022 Summer Internship Program. This internship gives you exposure to our full process from scrap metal to finished rebar. You will work alongside production, maintenance, engineering and leadership to put your education to practice and build a career for yourself. You will be provided meaningful projects that not only develop you but leave a long standing impact to our melting, continuous-continous casting and rolling process. In all, you will walk away with experience in:

Job shadowing highly skilled Engineers (Automation, Electrical, Mechanical, Reliability) and leadership
Mentorship Assignment
Networking with fellow interns and buisness leaders
Meaningful assignments
Summer Project Presentation
What You'll Do
Cross-train through the department to learn hands-on skills related to industrial/engineering technologies
Document and report/suggest changes
Work with leadership on ways to improve & sustain processes
Create/Review/Update existing process flow layouts
Identify, evaluate, and recommend cost saving opportunities by identifying process, quality and safety related improvement projects
Presentation/Report on an improvement project at the end of internship
Interact with technical engineers and non-technical operations personnel to integrate new technologies and update existing systems, as well as provide technical troubleshooting support to operations.
What You'll Need
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills with an aptitude of problem solving
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to work in teams and to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization
Able to work independently, take initiative and drive for results with minimal supervision
Ability to interact with coworkers and customers in a positive manner, follow directions and work rules and accept constructive feedback required
Must be at least 18 years old
Understanding of Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement processes

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.

If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways that connect our communities, and raise the bar for what it means to do meaningful work day in and day out. In short, you’re ready to be part of CMC. Join us and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

position: Data Science Intern - University Students - FinLab
description:
Who You'll Work With
You will work in our Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Phoenix, or Waltham office with our FinLab team for 10 weeks.
You will work with analytics colleagues, software engineers and architects, McKinsey consultants and clients to carry out complex analyses, build statistical and machine learning models, and develop actionable recommendations for a wide-range of strategic topics in industries such as financial services, real estate, retail and public sector.
McKinsey works with clients in many industries to build custom software solutions that combine deep industry expertise, strategic insights and AI/ML analytics to solve high impact business problems.
What You'll Do
You will perform statistical data analyses, data mining and optimizations using multiple tools and techniques to get insights from large complex data sets.
In this role, you will conduct hands-on rigorous quantitative analysis including getting the data, cleaning it (when necessary/relevant) and exploring it for accuracy. Additionally, you'll deploy statistical modeling and optimization techniques most suited for the business problem (using R, Python, SQL, and/or other relevant tools).
For 10 weeks over the summer, our full time internship program offers undergraduate students and eligible graduate students first-hand experience with digital and analytics consulting at McKinsey. You will participate in an introductory training program, as well as a range of social activities to get to know your office and the firm.
Qualifications
University student in a STEM related field (e.g. computer science) with expected graduation date between December 2022 to June 2023; master’s student completing the first year in a non-business, 2-year master’s program with less than 2 years of work experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques and recommendation and optimization algorithms
Experience in two or more programming languages (R, Python, C++)
Ability to easily understand the complex algorithm and logic to process data
Experience working with a large volume of data with ability to solve performance issues
Basic business intuition and clear expertise in analyses with the ability to describe analytic processes, including when and why specific approaches are favored
Strong command of English language (both verbal and written)

position: Data Science and Machine Learning Internship
description:
ADP is hiring a Data Science & Machine Learning PhD Co-op . Are you looking for real corporate experience at a Fortune 250 company? Do you want to make a valuable contribution to a business' success? Are you ready to join an energetic, collaborative team and experience an inclusive culture of belonging?
If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and see for yourself.

As a Co-op at ADP, you will work on one or more data science projects within ADP’s Chief Data Office & Global Product & Technology department. These opportunities are designed to facilitate the transition from academia to industry for soon-to-be graduates and will involve participation and contribution in real projects being carried out by the ADP data science team. This is also a way for you to identify if ADP may be the right company for your long-term career goals. These positions are typically 3-6 months long, and have various start dates throughout the year. Most of the projects will involve tools and analyses in support of ADP’s product objectives.

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos .

Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now!

WHAT YOU'LL DO :
Here's what you can expect on a typical day as a Data Science Co-op:
Candidates will be responsible for providing analytical and technical support, which includes the collection and analysis of internal and external data to assist in building relevant products. Candidates will help to solve novel questions through tool creation. Projects may be product specific or focused on issues spanning multiple products.

TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Currently enrolled in a PhD degree program in Computer Science or related Quantitative discipline such as: Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics Economics, Computational Biology, Biostatistics or other relevant discipline. Expected to graduate in the next 1-2 years. Fluency in at least one programming environments such as Python/R/Scala and sound understanding of OOP. Ability to quickly prototype solutions to communicate their results by creating endpoints, APIs, and/or front-ends (e.g. Shiny, Flask, etc.) Familiarity with the nuances of data science and advanced statistical methods and ability to determine the correct method for the task. Demonstrated ability to problem solve independently on complex analytical projects (supporting evidence could include conference or journal papers, talks, open source contributions, articles, etc.) Applicants will be required to serve as the quantitative methodology expert by developing creative solutions and applying appropriate statistical and/or machine learning methodologies to answer novel questions. Applicants should be effective oral and written communicators. Applicants have a history of being able to execute on minimum viable products and strike a balance between methodological rigor and project timelines/deliverables. Experience with one or more of the standard machine learning and data manipulation packages such as scikit-learn/numpy/pandas/mlr. Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (Torch, Tensorflow, etc.) Familiarity with managed services on the cloud (for example: DataBricks, SageMaker, ML Flow, etc.) Familiarity with SQL & noSQL databases: Redshift/BQ/Athena/Mongo. Familiarity with Natural Language Processing, Image Processing, Reinforcement Learning, Deep Neural Networks, Graphs, etc.

YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:
Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner.
Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life.
What are you waiting for? Apply today!
Explore our COVID-19 page https://tech.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.

Now Hiring Automation Engineering Interns for our 2022 Summer Internship!

There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Competitive compensation
Advancement opportunities
Training
Paid time off
Low-cost medical, dental, vision
Company-paid life and disability
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Why This Job

To be a leader you’ve got to stay ahead of the curve. That’s why CMC has always been — and will continue to be — an early adopter of smart, new manufacturing techniques and technology. Our automated Steel Micro Mill in Durant, OK melted and rolled our first heat in December of 2017. We connect the two main steps in rebar production - melting recyced scrap into molten steel and forming that steel into a finished product in a single uninterrupted strand. We also use energy more efficiently than the mini mill and our technology allows us to cast steel faster and to run continuously.

Internship Details

CMC Steel Oklahoma is seeking students currently enrolled in an accredited Bachelor's Automation-related degree program (Automation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronic Engineering, Computer Science) for our 2022 Summer Internship Program. This internship gives you exposure to our full process from scrap metal to finished rebar. Passion

Now Hiring Automation Engineering Interns for our 2022 Summer Internship!

There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Why This Job

To be a leader you’ve got to stay ahead of the curve. That’s why CMC has always been — and will continue to be — an early adopter of smart, new manufacturing techniques and technology. Our automated Steel Micro Mill in Durant, OK melted and rolled our first heat in December of 2017. We connect the two main steps in rebar production - melting recyced scrap into molten steel and forming that steel into a finished product in a single uninterrupted strand. We also use energy more efficiently than the mini mill and our technology allows us to cast steel faster and to run continuously.

Internship Details

CMC Steel Oklahoma is seeking students currently enrolled in an accredited Bachelor's Automation-related degree program (Automation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronic Engineering, Computer Science) for our 2022 Summer Internship Program. This internship gives you exposure to our full process from scrap metal to finished rebar. You will work alongside production, maintenance, engineering and leadership to put your education to practice and build a career for yourself. You will be provided meaningful projects that not only develop you but leave a long standing impact to our melting, continuous-continous casting and rolling process. Job shadowing highly skilled Engineers (Automation, Electrical, Mechanical, Reliability) and leadership
Mentorship Assignment
Networking with fellow interns and buisness leaders
Meaningful assignments
Summer Project Presentation

Cross-train through the department to learn hands-on skills related to industrial/engineering technologies
Document and report/suggest changes
Work with leadership on ways to improve & sustain processes
Create/Review/Update existing process flow layouts
Identify, evaluate, and recommend cost saving opportunities by identifying process, quality and safety related improvement projects
Presentation/Report on an improvement project at the end of internship
Interact with technical engineers and non-technical operations personnel to integrate new technologies and update existing systems, as well as provide technical troubleshooting support to operations.
What You'll Need
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills with an aptitude of problem solving
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with ability to work in teams and to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization
Able to work independently, take initiative and drive for results with minimal supervision
Ability to interact with coworkers and customers in a positive manner, follow directions and work rules and accept constructive feedback required
Must be at least 18 years old
Understanding of Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement processes

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.

If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways that connect our communities, and raise the bar for what it means to do meaningful work day in and day out. Verily, an Alphabet company, lives at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world's health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives.

Our team combines expertise in healthcare, data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solutions span three primary areas: research, care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes connected tools, lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. We're also actively working to combat the spread of COVID-19 through new programs like Healthy at Work.

Description

Verily's internship is a paid 13 week program for rising seniors, either undergraduate or graduate students, who are interested in working at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. The program is designed for all students, and again this year we encourage students who have been historically underrepresented in this field to explore the program, which is a pathway towards full-time employment within Verily. This includes but is not limited to: Black/African-American, Latinx/Hispanic, Native American, students with disabilities, veterans, and non-binary people.

Our mission is to translate advances in machine learning into patient care with the goal of empowering surgeons for better patient outcomes. Together, with industry partners and clinical experts, we are working at the intersection of deep learning, machine perception, natural language understanding, ML and cloud-based systems to develop and deploy scalable data-driven models in clinical settings. As part of the research team, you will be involved in developing and executing a research agenda of creating experiments, designing algorithms, prototyping implementations, deploying models and supporting other product areas. You'll also be encouraged to contribute to the wider research community by publishing your findings.

**Join us for a unique 13 week internship that will take place May 16th to August 12th 2022 OR June 13th to September 9th 2022

Responsibilities
Take part in developing and executing a research agenda on machine learning with a translational research focus on healthcare products.
Write peer-reviewed code in Python or C++ for training and deploying models.
Develop algorithms for analyzing large-scale healthcare data.
Share research findings with peers, managers and other cross-functional teams.
Contribute towards publishing in top venues in the field.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in university as a full-time BS, MS or PhD student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical engineering or an allied discipline, with an anticipated graduation date on or before the end of 2023.
Ability to work independently, write proficient code and collaborate effectively.
Authorization to study or work in the United States.

Preferred Qualifications:
Industrial and/or academic research experience in applying machine learning, computer vision and natural language understanding techniques to healthcare problems.

About Us

Protagonist is a women-owned, women-led small business and a pioneer in narrative research, analysis, and strategy. We help our clients harness the power of narratives by illuminating the stories that matter to their mission, analyzing the influences and influencers that are driving those narratives, and developing strategies for navigating and shaping those narrative landscapes. Over the past decade, we have developed a line of state-of-the-art narrative products that focus on the deep, enduring stories that define a population's identity, shape their perspectives, and describe their beliefs. Our Narrative Analytics® technology platform is relied on by dozens of the world's leading corporations, government agencies, and nonprofits to identify, quantify, and track narratives in online conversations. We have team members in Washington, DC, San Francisco, Chicago, and many points in between.

About You

The Protagonist Intern has a passion for understanding the deeply held beliefs - the narratives - that drive critical issues. Our Machine Learning (ML) Engineer Intern supports the continued development of our internal tools that comprise our Narrative Analytics offering—a suite of ML and natural language processing (NLP) capabilities that work to distill the beliefs of populations around the world, as expressed in online conversations. You have a passion for applying innovative ML and NLP solutions to solve hard problems, are deeply data-savvy, and have outstanding technical skills.

Analyzing complex problems, and iterating and persisting towards a sustainable technical solution.
Developing prototype models with the goal of bring the model to production.
Collaborating with team members on iterations of code development.
Leveraging GPU infrastructure to train and run models.

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science intern validates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts.

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

Are you starting your IT career and looking for your first real-world position? What is an internship? An internship is a chance for you to put your IT Training to use and work with real IT professionals! (oh, and get paid!)

We have partnered with IT companies across the state of Arkansas to offer opportunities in Web Development and IT Operations positions (Cyber, Help Desk, Networking).

What will you do? You will work on a real IT project and have a professional mentor along the way.

Details:
Pay: $15-20/hour, depending on experience
Schedule: Typically 8-5 Monday-Friday, but can often be flexible, maintaining a 40 hour work week
Timeline: 3-6 months
Location: Most of our internship opportunities are in person. Current opportunities are in NWA or Central Arkansas

Then what? Let's keep growing your career! There could be a chance for a full time offer as a result of the internship experience. Our ACDS Talent Team will still be here for you, connecting you with other employers seeing full time or apprenticeship candidates.

Recent (or soon-to-be) graduates in one of the following: Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, or other IT related program
Self-taught individuals passionate about a career in IT
Anyone currently employed and looking for a career change into Technology
Service members within 6 months of military-to-civilian transition
Probably you, if you're still reading…

Ability to work in the United States without a current or future need for visa sponsorship
Current Arkansas state resident
High curiosity and interest in learning new technologies and growing or starting your IT career
Exhibited technical aptitude through projects or previous experience and ability to communicate what you know

ABOUT OPENSESAME

OpenSesame helps develop the world's most productive and admired workforces. With the most comprehensive catalog of elearning courses from the world's top publishers, we are here to help you every step of the way, from finding courses, mapping them to your core competencies, syncing them with your LMS to increasing utilization and improving your L&D programs. Not only will you have the flexibility of multiple purchasing options from OpenSesame, you'll find it simple to use and administer your e-learning courses. To learn more, visit www.opensesame.com/about.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The OpenSesame Engineering team is offering a paid summer internship position for qualified students starting in June 2022 running for a total of 10 weeks. If you are a self-starter with an inquisitive mind and enjoy working on fun, useful projects, then check out this internship opportunity!

PROGRAM OVERVIEW

Our interns work side by side with members of our team to create software that is rolled to production every two weeks. You will be an apprentice on an experienced agile team and learn first hand how software is created here at OpenSesame. As you become part of our team, you'll work with us to:

Develop and execute individual & team goals (both personal and professional)
Work on individual & team software engineering projects
Learn and share the latest technology (programming languages, tools, team practices, etc.)
Learn how each department interacts in our company
Join in each team meeting & event
Network with other interns and our software engineers for the best experience possible

RESPONSIBILITIES

Pair program with members of our team.
Partake in team discussions about how to utilize and build new tools and technologies
Be proactive in working with team members
Become proficient through pair programming with our team so that you can handle tasks of your own
Suggest solutions to any inefficiencies in our processes
Maintain a strong desire to learn and willingness to jump in and help out any member of the team

Here is some of the technology we use at OpenSesame:
Typescript
Node
PHP
C#
Python
Terraform
Docker
AWS

We don't expect you to know all of this, but we hope that you want to learn it all!

REQUIREMENTS

A cover letter is required to be considered. Please tell us about yourself and why you want to work with us!
Our start-up environment requires an imaginative thinker with the ability to work independently on simultaneous projects and the ability to collaborate effectively with other team members.
Posses an adaptable, people oriented, friendly can do attitude
A desire to constantly develop new skills
Permanent legal right to work within the United States
You must be a college student in your junior or senior year with completed coursework in Computer Science or a recent graduate of a 4 year program in Computer Science or a related field

Become the Best Version of Yourself

We want OpenSesame to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and the world we live in.
We know that a variety of perspectives and voices strengthen our ability to deliver the spark of learning to everyone.
We hold ourselves accountable to create more diverse, equitable, and inclusive communities through continuous learning, personal growth, and working to support our customers.
We welcome you to bring your authentic self to our team and grow beyond your expectations.

Back to the Roots is currently searching for an intern to help us! We are looking for someone excited to join our passionate & energetic team to fulfill our mission of spreading the magic of gardening to every home in America.

ABOUT BACK TO THE ROOTS

Back to the Roots is America's #1 Organic Gardening brand, and the largest millennial gardening brand in the world!

It all started with a random fact heard in a college class: mushrooms could be grown on spent coffee grounds. Alejandro Velez and Nikhil Arora's mutual curiosity about urban farming brought them together and after successfully growing their own crop of mushrooms, they gave up their corporate job offers to become full-time urban mushroom farmers in Oakland, CA.

Back to the Roots has evolved from a college kitchen experiment into a passion for gardening and a mission to help a new generation grow, regardless of space or experience. With a wide range of gardening products from grow kits, to seeds, to live plants and raised beds - we want to help every family experience the magic and joy of gardening and growing their own food.

Our products are part of thousands of classroom curriculums nationwide, and sold in 10,000+ stores including Walmart, The Home Depot, Lowe's, Target, Amazon, Whole Foods, HEB, and Costco.

Each Back to the Roots team member contributes directly to the success of our mission. We pride ourselves on being a small-but-mighty team who work hard and have fun doing it.

To learn more, visit www.backtotheroots.com or check out our latest feature in Forbes Magazine!

description:
lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in sweating, growing, connecting, and being well.

At lululemon, we set audacious goals, nurture big growth and engineer innovative products that allow people to feel--and perform--their best. To us, leadership is more than a role or title--it's a way of being. We are all leaders, committed to growth and results.

We're looking for you. Join us!

Our IDEA Global Internship Program

Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time paid internship for approximately 12 weeks starting in September 2021. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand your career possibilities.

Through the course of the program, we've designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences.

The program is one of the many ways we are creating action on our [1] IDEA (Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Action) Commitments. As we move towards our Be Human Impact Agenda goal of reflecting the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025, we are cultivating an environment and building systems that will create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. This program is an investment in diverse talent that directly supports that goal and the IDEA mission to expand being well to encompass a culture of inclusion where diversity is celebrated, equity is the norm, and action is the commitment.

We strongly encourage applicants who identify as part of a group that has been historically underrepresented in the workforce to apply, including, but not limited to:

For internships in North America: Asian, Black, Indigenous, Hispanic or LatinX, South Asian, LGBTQ2S+ and applicants with disabilities. For internships in Australia: Indigenous (including Maori, Aboriginal and Torres Straight Islanders), ethnic minorities (this includes where an applicant belongs to an ethnic or racial group that is not the dominant ethnic or racial group in Australia), Low-Socio Economic,LGBTQ2S+,applicants with disabilities, LatinX and Black.
About this team

VASP stands for Visualization and Space planning. Our business vision is to enable a solution that allows our visual merchandising and retail teams to plan, execute and analyze using product and store data. The goal is to view and plan product assortments by store, end to end, from pre-season planning through in-season execution.

This solution will be a visualization hub and an interactive platform that enables--virtual immersive experiences, collaboration canvas, visuals on-demand, unique store curation and realization of quick and accurate merchandising layouts. This will combine major components consisting of product images, assortment plans, colors and store information to realize our vision. It will lift ability of merchandising teams to bring products to market and assort by store and help guide in-store teams to efficiently implement and adapt on market strategies for their unique community and store setting.

A day in the life

In this exciting role the Associate Systems Engineer Intern will be part of an engaged team that wants to be at the heart of the technology that realizes the business vision. They will be a part of the VASP Technology team and will get exposure to all cycles of the software development lifecycle. Their duties include:

Application SME (Subject Matter Expert) for our third party vendor application. Application administration and operations owner from the technology side. Map and apply the data flow process and administrative configuration and management of 3rd party vendor application for visual merchandising of seasonal store product assortment in virtual store/planogramming. Collaborate with vendor, dev, and QA to validate successful corrections to vendor application defects. Working with other Engineers on implementing integrations and custom solutions. Documenting their work in detail, reviewing and understanding the overall approach and system architecture Participating in all sprint planning, daily scrums, and retrospective meetings. Working closely with Business Analysts and Product Managers to understand the requirements.
Nice to haves

Pursuing or has a relevant education or experience in Computer science engineering or related field. Strong communication skills and can easily work with cross functional technical teams Knowledge of cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.), or eagerness to learn the cloud stack Knowledge of SQL Knowledge of Java, Sprintboot, Kafka Knowledge of Github
Must haves

Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn't take themselves too seriously

Back to the Roots is currently searching for an intern to help us! We are looking for someone excited to join our passionate & energetic team to fulfill our mission of spreading the magic of gardening to every home in America.

ABOUT BACK TO THE ROOTS

Back to the Roots is America's #1 Organic Gardening brand, and the largest millennial gardening brand in the world!

It all started with a random fact heard in a college class: mushrooms could be grown on spent coffee grounds. Alejandro Velez and Nikhil Arora's mutual curiosity about urban farming brought them together and after successfully growing their own crop of mushrooms, they gave up their corporate job offers to become full-time urban mushroom farmers in Oakland, CA.

Back to the Roots has evolved from a college kitchen experiment into a passion for gardening and a mission to help a new generation grow, regardless of space or experience. With a wide range of gardening products from grow kits, to seeds, to live plants and raised beds - we want to help every family experience the magic and joy of gardening and growing their own food.

Our products are part of thousands of classroom curriculums nationwide, and sold in 10,000+ stores including Walmart, The Home Depot, Lowe's, Target, Amazon, Whole Foods, HEB, and Costco.

Each Back to the Roots team member contributes directly to the success of our mission. We pride ourselves on being a small-but-mighty team who work hard and have fun doing it.

To learn more, visit www.backtotheroots.com or check out our latest feature in Forbes Magazine!

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

We are looking for a self-starter willing to go out on a limb and try new things. Someone who can:

Hit a snag and find the grit to push through it because the best lessons always come hard-fought.
Is always ready to pick up new technologies and concepts.
Does not mind getting into the nitty-gritty of the details.
Who is comfortable working remotely without constant oversight.

We are building tools for business development, sales reporting, inventory tracking, ecommerce order management, and more. You will have the opportunity to work on projects and see immediate use, results, and feedback for refinement in the real world with real consequences. You will work collaboratively in an open environment with a small team and your contributions will be impactful from day 1.

This work ranges broadly as we tackle various business needs in a growing company that commercial software can struggle to fill the niche for.

Knowing what EDI is and what saying “received an 852” means.

Experience with GSheet/Excel formulae. Some knowledge of and how to use effectively VLOOKUPS (yes it’s still useful in certain cases), INDEX/MATCH, QUERY, FILTER, SORTN, etc.
Experience with Python scripting at least an intermediate level. Flask and Requests especially.
Basic knowledge of SQL.

Are you starting your IT career and looking for your first real-world position? ACDS is growing our successful Work Based Learning Internship program and would love to talk to you!

What is an internship? An internship is a chance for you to put your IT Training to use and work with real IT professionals! (oh, and get paid!)

We have partnered with IT companies across the state of Arkansas to offer opportunities in Web Development and IT Operations positions (Cyber, Help Desk, Networking).

Schedule: Typically 8-5 Monday-Friday, but can often be flexible, maintaining a 40 hour work week
Timeline: 3-6 months
Location: Most of our internship opportunities are in person. Current opportunities are in NWA or Central Arkansas

Our ACDS Talent Team will still be here for you, connecting you with other employers seeing full time or apprenticeship candidates.

Recent (or soon-to-be) graduates in one of the following: Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, or other IT related program

Anyone currently employed and looking for a career change into Technology
Service members within 6 months of military-to-civilian transition
Probably you, if you're still reading…

Ability to work in the United States without a current or future need for visa sponsorship
Current Arkansas state resident
High curiosity and interest in learning new technologies and growing or starting your IT career
Exhibited technical aptitude through projects or previous experience and ability to communicate what you know

About Litepoint

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. LitePoint is a wholly owned subsidiary of Teradyne (NYSE: TER), a leading supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. In 2020, the combined corporation had revenue of $3.1 billion and employs approximately 5,500 people worldwide.

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

PLEASE ONLY APPLY FOR THIS POSITION ONCE - USA or Canada. Location preferences are specified within the job title. Multiple applications may delay our recruitment process.

As a research intern at Pinterest Labs, you'll work on tackling new challenges in machine learning and artificial intelligence. You'll conduct research that can be applied across Pinterest engineering teams and engage in external collaborations and mentoring, while also performing research in any of the following areas: image recognition, user modeling, recommender systems, natural language processing, and big data analytics. We offer a 12-week summer internship program in our San Francisco, Palo Alto, and Seattle offices.

What you'll do:
Contribute to cutting-edge research in machine learning and artificial intelligence that can be applied to Pinterest problems
Collect, analyze, and synthesize findings from data and build intelligent data-driven model
Write clean, efficient, and sustainable code
Use machine learning, natural language processing, and graph analysis to solve modeling and ranking problems across discovery, ads and search
Scope and independently solve moderately complex problems
Take proactive ownership over the completion and quality of your tasks and project with minimal guidance from your mentor, manager, and peers.

What we're looking for:
Working towards a PhD in Computer Science, ML, NLP, Statistics, Information Sciences or related field
Mastery of at least one systems languages (Java, C++, Python) or one ML framework (Tensorflow, Pytorch, MLFlow)
Experience in research and in solving analytical problems
Strong communicator and team player. Being able to find solutions for open-ended problems.

Preferred Qualifications:
Publications in machine learning, AI, data science, data analytics, statistics, or related technical fields
Strong passion for research and for answering hard questions with research
Passion for applied ML and the Pinterest product

Want to Work for a Different Type of Software Company? Join the Guidewire team!
At Guidewire, we pride ourselves on our inclusive and collaborative company culture. As part of our intern program, our talented engineers will train and mentor you as you engage in meaningful work on our industry-leading software products.

Who are we and what do we do?
Guidewire is a rapidly growing software company that delivers the industry-standard platform that Property and Casualty insurers rely upon to stay ahead of the curve in a time of accelerating change. We provide software, services, and partner ecosystem that empower our customers to run, differentiate and grow their business.
What will I be doing?
We are offering a 12-week (June to August) summer internship program for software engineers in 2022. The program is designed to give students actively pursuing a degree in Computer Science an opportunity to write software and interact with others in a real-world business environment.
You will be part of our Product Development team based in San Mateo, where you will work with a dedicated mentor and other fellow interns on a software project that adds value to our mission here at Guidewire.
Guidewire is an Agile development shop: we do iterative development, break features into stories, work in priority order, encourage pair programming and more. Our focus is to make the highest quality software for our customers and deliver it on time. We spend quality time focusing on software development as a craft. If you intern here, you will collaborate with teammates, mentors, and stakeholders while learning what it means to be a professional software engineer.

Requirements:
Currently enrolled in a BS or MS program in Computer Science, with an expected graduation date of Spring 2023
Programming in Java (preferred) or other modern OO programming languages
Experience with databases and SQL queries
Development with QA automation tools like Selenium
REST API development and testing with tools like Postman
Familiarity with Agile and Test-driven development

Other types of things that we like to cultivate:
Curiosity based on genuine love of technology and solving tough technical problems
Accountability based on an earnest desire to do what is expected without prompting
Kindness and respect for your fellow teammates
About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.

Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.

As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.

Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Northrop Grumman is seeking an intern to join the Atmospheric Effects Group Intern Program. This position will be located in McLean, VA.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Payload and Ground Systems Division.

The Atmospheric Effects Group is developing atmospheric models and prediction systems to help understand and mitigate atmospheric effects on optical communications in support of multiple NASA missions. We are seeking an intern for the Summer of 2022 to gain hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Numerical Weather Prediction and data analysis to support these missions. Internship will be performed in a hybrid work environment including in-person and virtual.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of engineering specializations that may include:

Roles and Responsibilities

Intern will work under the supervision of a technical lead.
Will learn to run existing atmospheric models and tools (e.g., WRF and other custom tools).
Analyze large datasets with Python and produce summary results.
Compose and deliver weekly technical briefings to team.

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in Meteorology, Data Science, Computer Science or similar STEM.
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Proficient knowledge of Python (numpy, matplotlib, cartopy)
Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience with NOAA GOES satellite data
Working knowledge of statistics for data analysis
Well-organized and detail oriented
Good written and oral communication skills
Able to work in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher

Intern Pay Range:
Bachelors: $24.00 - $29.75

Masters: $32.25 - $33.25

At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Verily, an Alphabet company, lives at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world's health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives.

Our team combines expertise in healthcare, data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solutions span three primary areas: research, care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes connected tools, lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. We're also actively working to combat the spread of COVID-19 through new programs like Healthy at Work.

Description

Verily's internship is a paid 13 week program for rising seniors, either undergraduate or graduate students, who are interested in working at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. The program is designed for all students, and again this year we encourage students who have been historically underrepresented in this field to explore the program, which is a pathway towards full-time employment within Verily. This includes but is not limited to: Black/African-American, Latinx/Hispanic, Native American, students with disabilities, veterans, and non-binary people.

Our mission is to translate advances in machine learning into patient care with the goal of empowering surgeons for better patient outcomes. Together, with industry partners and clinical experts, we are working at the intersection of deep learning, machine perception, natural language understanding, ML and cloud-based systems to develop and deploy scalable data-driven models in clinical settings. As part of the research team, you will be involved in developing and executing a research agenda of creating experiments, designing algorithms, prototyping implementations, deploying models and supporting other product areas. You'll also be encouraged to contribute to the wider research community by publishing your findings.

**Join us for a unique 13 week internship that will take place May 16th to August 12th 2022 OR June 13th to September 9th 2022

Responsibilities
Take part in developing and executing a research agenda on machine learning with a translational research focus on healthcare products.
Write peer-reviewed code in Python or C++ for training and deploying models.
Develop algorithms for analyzing large-scale healthcare data.
Share research findings with peers, managers and other cross-functional teams.
Contribute towards publishing in top venues in the field.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in university as a full-time BS, MS or PhD student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical engineering or an allied discipline, with an anticipated graduation date on or before the end of 2023.
Ability to work independently, write proficient code and collaborate effectively.
Authorization to study or work in the United States.

Preferred Qualifications:
Industrial and/or academic research experience in applying machine learning, computer vision and natural language understanding techniques to healthcare problems.

Northrop Grumman is seeking an intern to join the Atmospheric Effects Group Intern Program. This position will be located in McLean, VA.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Payload and Ground Systems Division.

The Atmospheric Effects Group is developing atmospheric models and prediction systems to help understand and mitigate atmospheric effects on optical communications in support of multiple NASA missions. We are seeking an intern for the Summer of 2022 to gain hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Numerical Weather Prediction and data analysis to support these missions. Internship will be performed in a hybrid work environment including in-person and virtual.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of engineering specializations that may include:

Roles and Responsibilities

Intern will work under the supervision of a technical lead.
Will learn to run existing atmospheric models and tools (e.g., WRF and other custom tools).
Analyze large datasets with Python and produce summary results.
Compose and deliver weekly technical briefings to team.

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in Meteorology, Data Science, Computer Science or similar STEM.
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Proficient knowledge of Python (numpy, matplotlib, cartopy)
Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience with NOAA GOES satellite data
Working knowledge of statistics for data analysis
Well-organized and detail oriented
Good written and oral communication skills
Able to work in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher

Intern Pay Range:
Bachelors: $24.00 - $29.75

Masters: $32.25 - $33.25

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

With world attention on both the environment and the economy, Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) is where policymakers and business leaders turn for win-win solutions. By focusing on strong science, uncommon partnerships and market-based approaches, we tackle urgent threats with practical solutions. We are one of the world’s largest environmental organizations, with more than two million members and a staff of approximately 700 scientists, economists, policy experts, and other professionals around the world. We operate in 22 geographies with unique projects running across four programs. You will be part of a vibrant workplace where innovation and results are a way of life.

EDF envisions a world in which people from all backgrounds and experiences feel connected to the environmental challenges we face and are engaged in creating durable, equitable solutions. We seek talented candidates who share our Core Values of Respect, Results, Innovation, Optimism, and Integrity, and support our Commitment to Diversity.

Responsibilities :
Job Description

EDF offers internships and fellowships for students and recent graduates in a variety of programs and departments throughout the organization. The ultimate goal of our internship and fellowship program is to provide high-quality experiences (including relevant projects and opportunities for networking) that form the foundation for any individual who is serious about pursuing an environmental career.

Program/Department Overview

MethaneSAT, LLC, an affiliate of Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) is launching a new, high performance, purpose-built satellite-MethaneSAT-to map and measure oil and gas methane emissions worldwide, with the potential to assess emissions from the full range of man-made sources. The satellite will enable us to gather methane emissions data on a global scale and with data from other sources, locate and quantify these emissions. Data from MethaneSAT will help EDF reduce methane emissions by 45% by 2025 and holds the potential to help reduce the temperature of our planet by as much 0.5 degrees C by the end of the century. This could be the most impactful environmental project yet conceived.

Overall Function

The intern will own a project end-to-end, including requirements gathering, design (creation, presentation, incorporating feedback and driving decision and consensus) as well as coding and deploying final solutions. The intern will be expected to learn and use the same tools (version control, code review, build tools, test suites, programming languages, compute resources, etc) as the software engineering team. At the end of their internship, the intern will present and/demo their results to the team.

Key Responsibilities

Tasks will include but are not limited to:
Solve problems involving large unstructured data and/or long-running, computationally expensive operations
Work with stakeholders on requirements and developing milestones
Learn and use industry best practices in software engineering, including a focus on creating high-performance, well-organized and maintainable code
Utilize test suites and configure infrastructure to deploy your solution
Report on progress and present your final results to the MethaneSAT team as well as the EDF technical community
Participate in advancing EDF DEI goals in which people from all backgrounds and experiences feel connected, included, and empowered to address the environmental and organizational challenges in alignment with EDF values

Qualifications

Enrolled in an accredited program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, Geophysical Sciences, Physics, Math or related field with coursework in Computer Science
Coursework in Data Structures strongly preferred
Interest or experience in big data or scientific processing
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work in a team setting and have the ability to work independently when projects are due
Respect for economic and cultural diversity and ability or experience working with diverse groups of people
Interest or experience in the space industry, methane science and policy, or climate change preferred
Ability to translate complex science and technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to independently recommend and determine approaches to completing projects and managing processes;
Ability to collaborate with colleagues and partners of varied backgrounds and experience;
Affinity for a fast paced work environment;
Must be well organized, motivated, and detail-oriented.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Demonstrates self-awareness, cultural competency and inclusivity, and ability to work with colleagues and stakeholders across diverse cultures and backgrounds.

Location

U.S. Remote. The team is primarily based in the East Coast of the United States.

Term

10 weeks (June - August 2022)

Hours

Full-Time (35 hr/week)

Compensation

This internship would involve either compensation for work paid at a rate competitive with leading non-profits or academic credit. Students are encouraged to seek academic credit or funding through their college/university and EDF will ensure that any and all paperwork needed to secure academic credit is completed.

Application Materials

Interested applicants should attach their cover letter and resume to the EDF application.

EEO Information:
Environmental Defense Fund is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.

The STARZ Content Insights group is a team of industry experts with backgrounds in linear, digital, and streaming data analytics, content strategy, and data engineering who serve as in-house advisers to key stakeholders and senior leadership on strategic decisions for STARZ content. Explain why your background and experience make you a great fit for Lionsgate & Starz
About the Company

Starz (www.starz.com), a Lionsgate company (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B), is a leading global media and entertainment company that produces and distributes premium streaming content to worldwide audiences across subscription television platforms. Starz is home to the flagship domestic STARZ® brand, STARZ ENCORE, 17 premium pay TV channels and the associated on-demand and online services, including the highly rated STARZ app. With the launch of the STARZPLAY international premium streaming platform and STARZ PLAY Arabia, Starz is expanding its global footprint in a growing number of territories. Sold through multichannel video distributors, including cable operators, satellite television providers, telecommunications companies, and other online and digital platforms, Starz offers subscribers more than 7,500 distinct premium television episodes and feature films, including STARZ Original series, first-run movies and other popular programming.

Business Unit Overview

Starz
With the Company aligning its studio operations behind the growth of its streaming business, Starz has become one of the pre-eminent modern premium global streaming platforms. Offering subscribers more than 7.500 television episodes, including Starz original series and provocative documentaries, along with a broad catalogue of first-run movies, Starz is taking the lead in delivering relatable premium content that makes it the platform of choice among a wide spectrum of female, African-American and other historically underserved audiences. Its focused brand, premium content and freedom from legacy relationships position Starz at the forefront of the new bundles emerging throughout the media ecosystem, a compelling value proposition to complement virtually every kind of subscription platform.

Distinguished by its successful and focused content strategy, top programming, exceptional curation and speed to market, Starz has quickly scaled its platform to become one of the most widely distributed and fastest-growing OTT services in the world, with OTT subscribers making up more than half of its global subscriber base. The Starzplay International premium subscription service offers a “best of global SVOD” content portfolio in more than 50 countries throughout Europe, Latin America, Canada, Japan and India through a bespoke and expanding network of distribution partners. The Starzplay Arabia joint venture is one of the leading SVOD operators in the fast-growing Middle East and North Africa region. The proprietary and highly-rated Starz app, a proven hit with U.S. audiences, continues to roll out internationally.

EEO Statement

Lionsgate is an equal employment opportunity employer. All employees and applicants are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws. In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

Consumer Insight, Measurement & Analytics (CIMA) is part of the Finance organization within Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. CIMA influences decision making with integrated, objective, and actionable insights.

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Our Visa internship program occurs during the summer months only.

Specific assignments will depend on upon your skills sets, interest, location and team needs. Job duties and projects could include:

Root cause analysis and documentation of software defects.
Apply critical thinking and problem solving skills to testing challenges.
Innovate on existing processes to drive continuous improvement.
Test and certify features for release
Write utilities / automation tools using Selenium, Java, REST, Python, Groovy, and more
Participate in cross-group and internal customer feature demos

Tech Interns will be placed within one of the following technology organizations at Visa:

Network Processing: This is the team behind VisaNet, the payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team strives to maintain quality through high-availability and high volume to enable industry collaboration and innovation today and tomorrow.

Issuer Processing: Debit Processing Services (DPS), our Issuer Processing platform for North America, processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

Merchant + Acquirer Processing: The team’s strategy is to build deeper merchant and acquirer relationships and increase total merchant value by developing solutions that address complex and emerging merchant and acquirer needs.

Digital and Developer Platform: Digital and Developer Platform (DDP) develops and manages platform-oriented technology to advance the global growth of digital commerce and the mobilization of payments. Pairing a customer-first approach and relentless product innovation, we build the underlying technologies that enhance value propositions for Visa cardholders and business partners around the world.

Data Product Development: Visa's position as the global leader in electronic payments enables us to collect and analyze a rich trove of data. Our team enables Visa to tell our data story through business intelligence and develop innovative data-driven products.

Data Platform: We timely deliver rich, high quality and easy-to-use Visa core data assets as a service, together with a reliable, scalable and secure data platform, that enables our internal partners to rapidly and efficiently innovate and monetize data-driven business products and services to lead the digital payment industry.

Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity provides enterprise-wide, risk-based security and continuity programs to meet changing internal and external threat landscapes. They seek to be the best-in-class at the physical, cyber security, network, application, and data security layers.

Corporate IT: CIT builds, operates and maintains the IT systems and infrastructure necessary to enable a highly connected and collaborative workforce that helps power Visa’s business.

Operations + Infrastructure: Operations & Infrastructure builds, operates and maintains best-in-class IT infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, and continuously available.

Open VisaNet: Open VisaNet (OVN) is responsible for building the long-term architecture for VisaNet and the future of our core payments processing capability. The team develops the next generation Authorization, Clearing and Settlement functionality that horizontally scales to support Global and domestic processing.

Visa Research: Visa Research is an organization that focuses exclusively on the scientific foundations of existing, emerging and future commerce-related technologies. With the establishment of a formal research organization and the associated long-term commitment to technology research, Visa joins the ranks of a small number of industry leaders with both the insight and ability to substantially influence and systemically impact the future.

Technology Planning and Business Operations (TPBO): Whether it is communications support, change efforts, or process improvements, this team is built to support the Technology organization.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing a Masters degree, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Business or a related field, graduating December 2022 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.

Preferred Qualifications

Proficiency in at least one programming language or technology including, but not limited, to Java, C/C++, C#, .NET, python, Javascript, HTML
Experience with Write utilities / automation tools using Selenium, REST, Python, Groovy, and more
Familiar with: JSON, MongoDB, AngularJS, ExpressJS, NodeJS, React
Experience with Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Spark, R, NoSQL
Familiarity with software testing principles
Solid understanding of software engineering concepts and methodologies
Lead root cause analysis and track defect resolution to completion
Review and provide feedback on development code, test designs and test cases
Communicate status frequently to project stakeholders
Highly driven, resourceful and results oriented
Strong ability to lead or drive a project from the beginning to the end with sufficient understanding of the goal.
